reviews.review:
Views From A New "Level". The stairs from near Rossario station lead you to another world of gorgeous views, shops and restaurants. Nothing more to say.
If the steps aren't your thing, take the funicular up and stroll down through the shops and cafes.

Great views and beautiful area of town. This is a great place to stop after visiting the nearby Sao Roque. The panoramas are fabulous and you get a fantastic view of Castelo de Sao Jorge on the opposite hill. There is plenty of benches to sit down and relax, beautiful large trees and shade, a pretty fountain, a garden below, numerous kiosk vending interesting crafts, overall it is a great place to visit and a must-do while in Lisbon.

Beautiful spot to view the Sao Jorge Castle. While the Gloria Elevador fills up quickly and is now mainly a tourist attraction, it is worth tramping up the steep hillside to visit this lovely spot overlooking the castle and bairros (neighbourhoods) near the Tejo River.

Absolutely stunning views. We walked up to this Miradouro a couple of times whilst we were in Lisbon. As well as the amazing views there is a little kiosk and a big square where you can sit and watch the world go by. There's also some stairs which take you down to a little park and another kiosk. For me this is the best view point in Lisbon.
walking. One fantastic sightseeing in Lisbon i recommend, and its nearby downtown and all needs, museums, restaurants etc

Great views. Great Views and a nice place to rest and take in Lisbon. There are vendors so you can buy refreshments or buy some local trinkets. Across the street is the Port Wine Museum and down this street a couple of blocks is the San Roche Church
Relax evening. Great views over the East/North and South side of Lisbon, with sometimes with ambience music provided by the numerous players that come and join the wonderful weather.

Great views. From this Miradouro there are terrific views of the Baixa and the Alfama districts. The views are particularly beautiful towards dusk, because of the light. There is no charge. This is merely a nice place to enjoy the views. There are plenty of cafes and bars nearby. The Elevador da Gloria is next to it. I cannot imagine anyone visiting the Bairro Alto or Chiado and not going there for a look.

So beautiful..... Wandering through Bairro Alto we came across this stunning place. The views of the city are truly fantastic and with the tree-lined park with fountain, a great place to stop and relax.

AN EXCELLENT SPOT FOR ROMANTIC WALKS AND GREAT PICTURES!. One of the best 'miradouros' of amazing Lisbon! you can approach it by foot or tram and the view (Alfama, Castelo Sao Jorge etc) from here is simply breathtaking especially during the sunset!! there are also nice musicians and great bar/restaurants around.... highly recommended!!

Fantastic view. From here you get a fantastic view of the city including the cathedral and the castle. It is also very easy to reach from the Avenida da Liberade by taking the Elevador de Gloria rather than face a steep climb.

Beautiful place, great atmosphere. We stayed in the vicinity of Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara and had the opportunity to stop and enjoy it a few times during our visit. Our last day in Lisbon was Saturday, and we spent a few hours hanging out there. There was live music, food and drinks of all kinds, beautiful view from Miradouro and beautiful people of Lisbon. Enjoed tremendously twilight time at Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara!

Beatiful views from a beautiful park. Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara sits perhaps 100 yards north of the top of Elevador de Gloria. We missed it when we exited the elevador to the left, but retraced our tracks when we realized we'd missed it.The first thing one notices about this park is the views of the city, a virtual 180+ degree view looking eastward. The most dominant view is of Castelo de Sao Jorge, towering high over the Alfama and the rest of the town. This is also the perfect spot to gaze over the countless red tile rooftops covering most of the city.So glad we didn't miss this park!

Amazing views of Lisbon!. Lisbon has a lot of places with great views (normal, with so many hills) called "miradouros", but this one is truly amazing. It is not only that it offers great views towards the Castle, the river and the city, but it is also close to Bairro Alto and Chiado and it is located in a wonderful park with natural shadow (from the many trees), 2 cafes where you can rest plus many benches where you can sit and enjoy the view.

A moment of enjoyment. Beautiful scene to Lisbon. But that is only the start. A pleasant living room with a small market place, benches to sit down, tables to enjoy your food with sangria, or just sangria.. Tourists and locals, a place worth to spend some time with a good comapnion.

Excepcional view !. Don't miss this! One of the best views towards the castle and the old neighborhood close by. Two cafeterias also allow you to drink something while you enjoy the view...Recommended!
Take the tram!. You can grab the Ascensor da Gloria instead of walking up to this lookout point. Nice view from the top.

Amazing view over the city. This is a really nice little park with an amazing view of the old city. There are a few shops too, but other than that there isn't much there except loads of tourists. It's mostly nice to pass by it on a walk through the neighbourhood.

One of my best spots in Lisbon. This place was one of my preferred spots in Lisbon. Amazing view on the city. Artists playing nice music. Painters drawing nice pieces you can take back home for your house or as gifts and souvenirs. You can grab a sandwich or a drink from shops nearby and enjoy it in this Miradouro. You can enjoy the sunset and then go down walking to Bairro Alto for the night
Great view !. It is one of the best view points (miradouros) in lisbon. Definitely worth a detour to explore better!

Beautiful view. So nice and sweet place. Wonderful view of the Lisbon. I can't be objective here, as all of the viewpoints are amazing, simply it is amazing city and no matter where are you looking it from it is still wonderful.
You will not skip this place as it is a part of many tours, and is near the center.

Stunning view to the city center. A very pleasant place having a lot of trees, benches, a fountain, café, gift kiosks and a great spectacular view to the city center which lies underneath. The place has two terraces: the upper one having all the above and with the most of visitors, and the lower one, more quiet. I would recommend to visit the lower one after 5 PM, when there is a natural shade from the wall, or after sunset – the view to the night Lisbon is also great! It is situated in the old historical part of the city, where I advise to get lost in, and just to stroll all the narrow streets.
A sunset delight. Yes, although the view is looking at the opposite side of the sunset, what you get is Lisbon and the castle hill bathed in the sunset reddish light, it´s like a fake scenario,

beautiful views of Castelo. Up Chiado and before the beautiful Principe Real square there is this lovely garden with beautigul views on another hill and district in Lisbon: Castelo. Very quiet before, it has been unfortunately much spoiled by hords of (often very drunk) people playing very loud music or making much much noise. Nevertheless, still plenty of charm

Coffee or drinks with a view!!. It's a unique view over Lisbon. Although this is S. Pedro's Garden only Café (for coffee, tea, drinks and small meals, snacks), it never closes (Summer or Winter - when they even borough blankets to costumers...) - so you shouldn't ever miss the experience.

Picturesque. A picturesque, elevated park built in two terraces. it has a lake, garden, fountain, sculptures and so on and you get a great panoramic view of Lisbon, including the castle. I recommend to grab a snack and some sangria and sit in the park and enjoy the view ;)

Beautiful panoramic view of Lisbon. I went at sunset and although the sun sets behind the viewpoint, the city looks beautiful at dusk. You get a great panoramic view of Lisbon including São Jorge castle. At dusk the lights come on across the city making it even more beautiful. There are are steps leading down to a small square in front with and you can enjoy drinks with the view at the cafe. We sat and watched the sunset before going to dinner in Bairro Alto. Recommend taking the funicular up as it is a steep climb.
Stunning view!. Beautiful elevated square with stunning views, especially at night! Then it is full of people enjoying a few drinks and the view! It's worth the hike up the hill!

Best view of Lisbon. This is our favourite place to sit looking at the view, have a drink and listen to the buskers. If you want to take some great pictures of the whole of Lisbon get the funicular or the elevator up to this place fabulous.

Super view to the white city. It has an amazing view, a litlle coffee shop with a terrace where you can enjoy a good coffee or tea, or even eat something, you have "electrico" that goes up and down to "Restauradores" and in there, you can enjoy some street art along the way.

great way to save your legs. I took the Gloria funicular up to Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara and had a wonderful view from the Square - Saved the legs as quite a steep climb - enjoyed a cup of coffee too

Great view of the city. If you've already been to Sao Jorge castle here is the place to look at it from another hill top! Best place to take panoramic photos of Lisbon and maybe a drink watching the city unfold.
Lovely place to enjoy the view . Stayed at lookout hostel close by and went here many times. Great for the view, have a drink and listen to street musicians. Loved it!
Probably the best view of Lisbon. If you're wandering around the Bairro Alto and Chiado areas, you can't miss this spot, as it provides what is, arguably, the best views of the city
Nice views. This is a great spot to view the city from. You can see the castle and cathedral next to the river and the high points and valleys of Lisbon. One of the best views in the city.
Perfect place to relax. I go to Lisbon often and no trip is complete without an afternoon glass of wine at this Miradouro. Lovely, peaceful view with a nice little cafe.
Loved it! . Was staying in Lookout Lisbon! Hostel (1 min walk away) so I am always at this miradouro when I have the time. Was never sick of the beautiful view it offers.
beautiful view. my favourite spot to relax, enjoy the view and there's a little café to get some coffee while enjoying the amazing view over Lisbon

Great views. Worth the walk to enjoy the spectacular views from this viewpoint, There are bars and restaurants in the area and the good news it is downhill at the end. Nice picture opportunities over the districts with the contrasting hills.

Great view and a beautiful place to have an espresso and pasteis.. I loved the Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara!! Great views, huge trees, little outdoor shops and we had a beautiful clear day. Just make sure you wear nonslippery shoes if you are walking down hill.
Great views across the city. Excellent spot for seeing the city. You can take the funicular railway from Avenida Da Liberdade for an even more fun visit

Great views, relaxing setting. There is a street fair for all of August at this spot. I really enjoyed grabbing a beer and just sitting on the bench and checking out the view. Highly recommended at sunset. Food, drinks, and souvenirs were overpriced compared to other spots.

Beautiful view on the red-roofed Lisbon. Get there from Praca dos Restauradores by Elevador da Gloria (3.60 Euros) or go uphill along the steep Calcada da Gloria (if you like climbing). Bus 758, too, can take you there from Rata or Praca Luis Camoes metro stations.

Great view of the city. Right of top of the Gloria funicular. Use the zapping metro card - much cheaper (use it for everything - trains, trolleys). Beautiful view of the castle. Nice park with a little café with wine and snacks.

Beautiful view. Elevador da gloria goes to this viewpoint. Stunning view of Lisbon, especially St. George castle. There is a nice fountain and it is possible to buy some souvenirs. Good place to see Lisbon from above.

Amazing and beautiful!. You get to see one of the most amazing views of Lisbon ever! And if you are lucky enough to see the sunset even better! There are actually two levels and you may sit there, drink a beer or even have a picnic! I could stay there for ever!

Great views, cool place. This is a great place to visit for the view across the valley to Castillo St Jorge and also the lovely small cafe/wine bar that's great for, coffee, snack, wine. Great service!
Stop for a nice photo. There is the place where all the tourists need to stop for a photo before go for a nice dinner or a crazy night out in Bairro alto. One of the best views of Lisbon!

Beautiful view of Lisbon. Beautiful view of Lisbon . Nice to get to the observation by the carriage Gloria . Recommended reach the observation in the early evening to enjoy the scenery in daylight and twilight time and early evening . Sometimes there are amateur musicians .
Good viewpoint. Good view point to view the city on hills. But honestly after a point all Miradouros start looking the same

One of the best views in Lisbon. Lisbon is known for it's views and it's light, although it has several "miradouros" this is one of my favorites we can see the old city, the river and the modern side of Lisboa.
And the best.... it's free.
Beautiful views. The viewpoint itself is gorgeous, well worth a visit when the market is on to pick up some traditional food/gifts. Only issue is the cafe is pricier than other parts of the city.
Fantastic views. We visited before have dinner at The Insolito, which is across the street. We enjoyed the various vendors and having a drink where we would enjoy the beautiful view of Lisbon.

Best view of Lisbon. Just passed by this viewpoint but decided to stay because of the good atmosphere! People were sitting at the fountain, the shadow and there's music. Just loved it! Make sure you go here.
Visit at sunset. Beautiful little park with great views over Lisbon. Market stalls with food & drinks, often music. Include it on your wandersing
Great views and atmosphere at night. Great little area. Views are great and we came across some lovely little area with music and drink at night . Worth a visit.

Great views. Stayed in the Barrio Alto and this was a lovely place to hang out and see the surrounding city. It was close to our loft. We went back several times and it's pretty lively. They had a festival going on there the one evening which we enjoyed. I think it's a romantic spot to see especially at night. If you are staying in the Barrio Alto you must check it out!
Great Views of the City of Lisbon. We took a tour of Lisbon in a tuk tuk. We were dropped off here for the views and photos. A nice spot to visit, very popular with the tours.

great view. This viewpoint is easy to reach (take Gloria elevador from Restauradores) and gives you great views over the city and the river. It is especially nice in the evening when the sun sets and everything is seen in that beautiful orange color. You can stroll down rue Sao Pedro de Alcantara and stop at Sao Rogue church (peek inside to see the contrast between the outside and the inside of the church). Go more down on rue de la Misericordia and stop at Fado in Chiado for a show - nice performance every night at 7 pm.

View, street market, terrace, music. Late afternoon, after a day of walking Lisbon, we ended up at this place to have glass of wine. There was a street market, people were playing music and there was a great view over Baixa, Alfama, Castelo,... Lovely place.

My favorite mirador in Lisbon. It is a million dollar view of the beautiful Lisbon. During the day, enjoy the sun and calmness, and during the night get a beer or sangria and enjoy the city of lights.
Beautiful views. Unfortunately there was a lot of constructions around it but the view is amazing. You can enjoy an ice cream while see the street artists painting-
Magnificant. One of the best overlook to Lisbon downtown! and close to one of the most typical old Lisbon quarter

I love this place. Take the Elevador da Gloria (the tram like funicular off Avenida da Liberdade) to the top and on your right there is the most glorious view of Lisbon towards the castle, especially at night. Whilst you are there walk into the nearby Bairo Alta which comes alive at night and into the early morning wher you can eat or drink in one of the many bars. A great way to just chill.

A lovely place to stroll in evening. We entered into Lisbon to 90+ degree heat after flying in from Barcelona. We took the Blue Line down to the city centre, ate some dinner, then took the funicular from Avenida da Liberdade up to the Bairro Alto. Immediately to your right as you exit the funicular sits the Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara. We strolled this lovely park at about 21.00h - as the temperatures dropped. Outdoor vendors sold beer, food and hand-made items, a caffe on the far end was showing the France-Iceland Euro2016 quarterfinal. Plenty benches to sit and enjoy the atmosphere. And the view of Lisbon? Gorgeous. A great photo spot. I've been told the area gets seedy as night goes on and the young people like to drink to drunkenness up in that area. Perhaps I would have wanted to experience that 30 years ago! Instead, we headed back down to the Praca dos Restauradores and strolled a bit more. It was Sunday and the city was quiet and vibrant but at a certain leisure that brought calm.

Stunning Views. From atop the mirador, I had expansive views over Lisbon. Castello de S. Jorge is visible across the sea of red tiled rooftops as is the Tagus River and just about everything else in between. The mirador itself can get crowded, but for good reason. There are numerous makeshift stalls selling anything from food and drink to local crafts.

best in the evening. great place to spend an evening, just around sunset. The western sun sheds a wonderful orange hue on a large part of Lisbon that lays before you. Few benches, paths and stalls selling desserts, fish and Sangria and street performers singing or just playing guitar made the evening magical.

Lovely panoramic city views from this location. Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara is a levelled public garden atop the hill in Bairro Alto. Here you find a nicely manicured area with flower beds, bench seating a public fountain and statue bust as well as wonderful panoramic views of the city of Lisbon. There are seats or you can just stand and admire the eastern part of Lisbon, looking down to Rossio or over to Castelo de Sao Jorge in the distance. It is a nice view point if you are planning to visit this area of the city.During our visit, there was a holiday fair taking place with quite a few food and drink stands sit up at Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara. This made for an interesting added distraction from the views we enjoyed from this garden location.

A great place any time of day. Firstly the view from here is fantastic - take time to read the map and identify the various buildings. This view point is a must and a good place to catch your breath after climbing up the Bairro Alto. Its also accessible from the top of the Gloria funicular. At the far end of the view point is this kiosk - service is friendly and the menu is suitable for all day. The toasties on rustic bread are large enough to share unless you are very hungry. The soup is home-made and a good option. The trees offer welcoming shade and the kiosk has a toilet for customers.

Romantic, beautiful look-out over Lisbon. The look-out point here with the idyllic garden will grant you one of the most beautiful and romantic views of whole Lisbon (and there are quite a few). You can easily see the fortress, topping the Alfama district.

My favourite place in Lisbon. Well, the park and the view is awesome and even better when you arrive from one of the small streets of bairro alto. You can spend some time in the shade of the trees or in the park below. You feel Lisbon here and then you continue down to Chiado. Love that.
Great view and break/chill spot.. stopped here with Pedro on walking/tapas tour, great view, shady, refreshments and bathroom available.

Excellent view of the city at no cost, just the walk up. As opposed to the view of the city from Castelo Sao Jorge located at the hill to the east, at the old city Alfama. The park is a pleasant 30min slow climb from Restaurandores Square, or one can pay 4euros for the tramp going up. A good evening 'passaggiata' to catch the sunset. After which you will not feel guilty to have a large and rich seafood dinner.

Stunning view. It is well worth going to this superb view over the city. I had read before of the three parts of the city, Alfama, Baixa and Avenida, and Bairro Alto and Estrela but had not appreciated that the first and last of this list are on hills and the Baixa and Avenida is in a valley until I went to this viewpoint. It was busy when I was there yesterday in the early evening with people enjoying listening to a very good band that was playing. There is also an interesting sculpture of a paper boy on a statue to Eduardo Coelho founder of an important newspaper in Lisbon.
Мagnificent views. The site has magnificent views of Lisbon. There are something like a small park. When I visited there was a festival of local food .

Lovely view day and night!. Lovely little viewpoint and park where locals and travelers alike can sit, talk, and have a drink while enjoying the breathtaking views Lisboa has to offer. I just missed it but a little artist fair was there for a few weeks prior.

Lovely view in the afternoon. This is my favorite Miradouro in Lisbon, because it's right across from the Castel Sao Jorge and you can see the nicest parts of Lisbon, plus a glimpse of the river, but none of the industrial areas near the banks of the river. It's so pleasant and calming, esp. in late afternoon when the golden sunshine illuminates the opposite side. There's usually some street musicians to add to the ambience - I could loiter there all afternoon, or have a late lunch at the kiosk.

take the Glória tram and enjoy the view. You can´t miss the view and the surroundings.You can go from there to Bairro Alto,just in front of the tram,go to Príncipe real(uphill) or to Chiado (down hill)Don´t miss Sâo Roque church nearby.

Amazing View! . My hotel is on top of avenue da liberdade. So instead of taking the Metro and then an elevator we took a cab to the Miradouro which costs just around 7 euro. This is the best way to see barrio alto and Chiado. And if you start here you walk down to Chiado which is easier than starting from Chiado to barrio alto which is where Miradouro is located. Great view of the city and the water. There are some vendors to buys souvenirs.

Brilliant viewing point across the city. To get here you can take a taxi to whizz you around the narrow streets to this viewing point,then the venicular tram to take you back down againThe is an amazing viewing point across the city, you have a huge panoramic view of everything – Avienda da Liberdade to the left, St Georges Castle straight across, and the river Tagus to the right.Do not miss the map of tiles which marks all the distinctive buildings. We were lucky enough to have a great sunny date and a lovely market = well worth a visit.

Magnificent view. My all-time favorite view point to relax, have a cappuccino and savor the changing light and sky.The castle sits majestically atop the hill and all the pastels blend into a beautiful potrait of Lisbon! !

This is a viewing platform. Great place to take photographs of Lisbon and Rio Tejo from this viewing park and take a rest. This park is shaded by a lot of trees and a lower platform has a laid out garden. You can get to this location on Tram 28.

Fabulous panoramic city views!. Located within the Bairro Alto, this miraduoro is a must do! Music provided by various street musicians fill the air while visitors enjoy the sweeping views of the city. Gloria Elevator is adjacent to the park - a fun way to descend to the Praca Restauradores area. Just past the elevator is a small square with a walkway that winds down to the Rossio Square area, passing many small street cafes along the way.

Fabulous view. Enjoy a fabulous view over Lisboa, especially Baixa and towards Castelo. At night time the panorama is even more spectacular.Don't forget to visit Convento de Sao Pedro de Alcantara just across road on the other side of Rua Dom Pedro V - spectacular azulejos !

Lovely spot. Just a lovely spot with a fountain and a great view, all the way to the castelo. There are little stands with food and drink, but there is also a restaurant with a nice terrace. You can get here with a little tram at the corner of Avenida Libertade and Rossio, on the train station side.

Lovely view. Good starting point for a long walk. Amazing view of the city. Enjoy a cup of coffee and start a walk downhill from there. You could also take the ancient tram that goes down and up again every 10 minutes.

Great view . Visited at night but before get dark, great spot with view on lower Lisbon. We got there walking from Chiada area and got back from there by Elevador Gloria. There are a few vendors with souvenirs and you can grab some wine sangria or hot wine and enjoy the view.
Excellent views and very close of night life. Very nice to visit. Pleasant place, close to good restaurants and night life area. Easy accesses. Difficult to park

Well worth orth the effort. Well worth the walk up the steep hill to the Miradouro. It has one of the best views of the city and a great cafe where we had lunch. In season you can use the Elevador da Gloria and save your legs.
just WOW. The only thing I can say about this Miradoure, or sightseeing point is WOW. I loved seeing the city from this point. Has so much enchantment. One of the best in my opinion.

360 view of orange-roof buildings. Just the perfect spot to take photos of the whole of Lisbon! You may opt for the orange tiled-roof buildings, the river or the castle on a hill backdrop for your souvenir photo of Lisbon. The way up via the centenarian elevator is also an experience on its own. The melodic chime of the bell toll singing is also an added sensory treat.

View over lower Libon. This place gives you a very nice view over the lower Lisbon. You have also a great view on the castle de San Jorge. The place itself had a fiew artist and singers. I can imagine that it is a wonderfull place in summertime. Unfortunately we visited Lisbon in a rainy week. Around the place there are several bars and restaurants. One restaurant is to be visited, "the Decadente"

Tapas and a drink. What a place to stand and look out over Lisbon. Small stalls sell cheese, ham, beer, sangria, port wine, drinks, etc. Take your plate and glass and enjoy the view. Once done - either walk to the old town or take the Elevador Gloria down to the center again. I cant imagine Ill ever be in Lisbon again without going here at least once.

The favourite Lisbon viewpoint. Among all Lisbon Miradoutos, Sao Pedro is absolutely the most quiet, breathtaking, relaxing. You can easily access it by the Elevador da Gloria. The panorama from up there is gorgeous. You can see all Lisbon as far as the river. The Sao Jorge Castle is in front of you. There is a nice kiosk serving beers or soft drinks. Very often there are small wooden shops selling Portuguese delicatessen or sweets or fresh and delicious orange and lemon juice.I highly recommend to relax for 1 hour sitting at Sao Pedro, taking the sun and looking at the scenic Lisbon.

Fantastic lookout with great bar service. Fun to come up here via the Glory funicular (even just to say the name of that!) and sample the famous Ginjinha or whatever else is your pleasure from the lovely kiosk. Then explore the neighbouring streets that sweep along the hillside and stroll back down via calcada do Duque and stop for a brew at the tiny but marvellous Duque brewpub.

Breath taking view!. Sublime view over Lisbon. From this point you overllok the Castle, all down town, the river ... And you are at the entrance of Bairro Alto. Best night life is Lisbon :)Not to be missed!

Romantice overview. As my wife and me were descovering small streets of Bairro Alto, at the end of one of 1001 sudendly we came onto the Sao Pedro Miraduro and view was just for that reason because we came to Lisbon :D For my wife :* :* :*
great views. we walked up the hill and were so happy to find the mirador. it was a beautiful, sunny day and not only the view was fantastic, so was the entertainment.
Miradouro San Pedro . Beautiful spot with great views, soft music among trees. Don't miss it. Vendors with food and classy ambience. Sit and take in the view and the peace!
Amazing!. No words to describe it!The view, the fado singer..That nigh I fell in love with Lisboa..Going back tomorrow :)

Best Miradouro of them all!. Went to every Miradouro here in Lisbon and in my oppinion this is the best miradouro. But even more I enjoyd "Santa Justa Lift" which had even better view to the whole city.

Best of a good bunch!. Lisbon is spoilt for choice when it comes to amazing views but for me this was the best in the city. It's a lovely spot with lots of seating, a nice kiosk serving good cocktails and fantastic views. Well worth taking some time out of your day to chill out here and watch the world go by.

Beautiful view. In my opinion, the best view over Lisbon. I've been to all the other miradouros twice and this is by far my favourite. It is a nice place to just sit and enjoy the sunset, listen to some music and have a drink. A very romantic place as well. Definitely recommend it!

What a view!. This is a really picturesque spot overlooking Lisbon and is well worth a visit.
It's on the bus and tram route and has lots of little shops, cafes and restaurants nearby.
It's got the prettiest views over the city in my view and I'm sure the sunsets are spectacular.
Lovely spot!

Nice view and perfect spot to start your sightseeing. Really nice view from the bairro alto over the whole city. Our apartment was next to this little viewpoint/garden and we started our excursions from here and often used the little train to bring us uphill again in the evenings.

Watch the sun go down over Lisboa. This viewpoint is up the hill from the main Bairro Chiado area on the way to Principe Real. It is a small area with trees, with a garden below, and a wonderful view across Lisboa to the castle and the river. Have a drink at the kiosk - which has charming staff - and watch the sun go down. The evening we were there a great band was playing and you can spend a lovely hour for the price of a drink.

Nice view over Lisbon. Opposite to the Castle, this miradouro as a wonderful view over downtown. Specially nice at the end of the afternoon. A litte to crowed spot during summer time and at night time.

One of the nicest views in the entire city of Lisboa!. We happened along this spot when visiting Sao Roque church and the Convento de Sao Pedro de Alcantara. Best view we had! Much better and more accessible than the view from the Castle. It's like a little gem on the side of the street.

One of the most beautiful viewpoints!. Located on one of the 7 hills of Lisbon. Arrive there either by the "elevator" (lift) of Gloria, by foot or on the yellow tramway that crosses the old town. You may admire the city profile, better to be seen at sunset while sipping a port wine or a "ginginha" (cherry liquor). Visit the nearby Port Wine bar (Solar do Vinho do Porto) located on an 18th cent. palace. Stroll around Bairro Alto.
wonderful place. wonderful place to be. love the outdoorsy cafe's , restaurants and slow paced lifestyle... definitely worth a visit.bring your camera

Beautiful view over Lisbon. Perfect place for a drink in the sun with a beautiful view over the oldest parts of Lisbon and the river. There are a small cafeteria serving soft drinks, alcohol and coffee.
If you are lucky there sometimes are a market with local products like cheese, jewelry and arts.
Views. Fantastic views of the city, great spot to sit relax and people watch. Nice bar at the top for refreshments. Worth the hike.

Soaking up Lisbon and sunshine. A great place to relax and get a view of the city and the river in the far distance. There are bars, small booths selling cheese, lemonade and crafts and - when we visited - a cool African band playing.
Does this place need an explanation?. Lisboa has plenty of miradouros to explore. I have been lucky enough to be at Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara in a sunny day and take beautiful pictures.

Nice view of the castle on the opposing hill.. Two view points are, the Iron Elevator, which is quite nice for sunsetting photos as is this location. Tis location is surrounded with nice inexpensive restaurants. With a drink (wine or water, or coke) and an espresso at the end about 10 euro

Great Park With a wonderful View. The first time we saw this park was when our driver pointed it out on our way from the airport to our apartment. The next time was on a walking tour, where we stopped for coffee and beer. This park has two levels and a fantastic view of the city and castle.We were in Lisbon for two weeks and this became a favorite place to stop and rest on our many walks around the city.

Great views.... We'd just had lunch and was walking back to hotel and stopped for photos. Decided to have a drink and this place also has a toilet!Only had a glass of wine each but sat under cover with heaters and blankets. The views are to die for, looking out over city and castle. If we hadn't eaten already, we would have here. Wine was 4 euro per glass. Service was very good. Go here and spend some time and linger...

A nice spot to view the city!. Right above barrio alto, it was the last place we visited before we left Lisbon. It offers a great view of the city. It also has a nice park, and a stone map that helps to identify what you see.I think it worths a little stop.

what a view. Had to walk up here has the little trams were temporary out of use. But it was certainly worth it also great fun watching the look on peoples faces has they go up the hill not sure if there is another way up but this way there is some great art works on the walls. When you do get to the top its WOW the view of the city is wonderful. This is deffo one place you must go...

Great for admiring views by day and party at night. The view from here is amazing. It is also the most 'active' miradouros in the city. In the evening you will find here quite a crowd, well who wouldn't like to party with a view like that. For beverages and snacks you can go across the street to Bairro Alto and Erasmus Corner.
Terraza. Since i diceded to go to Lisbon I was looking for high points where I can see the whole city with the bridge. This was defenetly one of the best places to make great panoramic pictures.
Do not miss!. I have been several times in this place...and I would return...the skyline of Lisbon from here ...absolutely great !

Nice point to get an overview of Lisbon. Conveniently located and easy to approach. Take Tram for Bairro Alto and once you get down of the Tram walk a little to your left and you are there. Enjoy the greenery of the park besides the wonderful view of the city.
It's a must :). My first miradouro in Lisbon. Fantastic view, nice place and really easy to find. You should get Gloria elevator or simply walk from igreja de sao roque

Maybe a Good place for a Rest. What a vista! Wore the shutter out on my camera and had to revert to the phone, a nice sunny day.
The disappointment was that the cafe in the mirador was more expensive than the main street shops. Beware.
Great vuews. This place has Lovely views - would be even nicer with sunshine!! Good place to get your bearings of the city. Would recommend.
My favourite viewing spot. Spectacular night views of Lisbon from here. Particularly impressive at night with the lights and sights of the city stretching out below.

One of the most beautiful views in Lisbon. Always beautiful, but particularly good in a hot sunny summer day, as it is in a cool quiet garden. Nice little coffee house available as well for a quick snack

Lovely views...some graffiti spoils it. We caught the tram up and it was worth it...the views were amazing except for graffiti spoiling the photos...male parts were the common theme so not easy to ignore.

Excellent view point.. View point of south side of city. Good access by the foot or "Elevador Da Gloria". Amazing view.
Place full of tourists even in January.

Great view and nice market - little church is also worth a visit. Our bnb was just round the corner from this delightful square so this was my first view of Lisbon and remained my favourite. You can see over the castle and down to the centre of town. On the Saturday morning there was a great little market. And do pop into the church of San Pedro. It is free and there is an amazing chapel entirely made up of inlaid stone as well as wonderful blue and white tiled confessionals in the church itself.
Great place with great view. A great place with a great view. My third favorite Miradouro in town. Really nice during the day and chill at night with a beer in hand. Definitely worth for a stop by.

Relax.. Stunning view from the top on Tejo River, Castelo St. Jorge,Miradouro da S.do Monte,etc.Relaxed atmosphere, guitar player, lovers,seniors playing cards.Good place to get back Your good mood after stressful day.
Great view. Great view of the city. Located right off the Main Street. If you don't want to walk up the hill, you can take the old trolley. Definitely worth a visit to relax and take in the city.

One of the best views of Lisbon. Once you have spent a long moment enjoying this amazing view of Lisbon, go and have a look at the nearby beautiful antique shops or, if you prefer visit the design fashion shops in the neibourhood. End up the afternoon with a good glas of port at the Solar do Vinho do Porto
ONE OF BEST VIEWS OVER LISBON. The sunset or at night is even more beautiful. A belvedere where you can have a drink and then go nearby (100 meters) have dinner to the typical Bairro Alto

Breathtaking in the morning. Amazing at night!. My hostel was located just off this very square! I arrived at night and I was amazed by the view! You can see the whole city! It gives you the impression that you can almost touch the monuments! The morning after, I took my time taking many pictures of the view at dawn. Amazing! It is maybe a little out of hand and not as popular as other view points, but it is definitely worth it! Enjoy!
Top class top view. Great view from the terrace which is the highest point in Lisbon.Sitting on a deck chair, drink in one hand and a panoramic view of Lisbon below. Sere and unhurried atmosphere
Good views. If you can walk up to this area there are good views across Lisbon - which I'm not sure you'd see from elsewhere.

beautiful. You can see the city from the top. I like it more in the night because i stayed in the park but if you want to take pictures you must go in the day time. If you come in the night you can walk from bar to bar in Bairro Alto after you see the miradouro.
Great relaxing stop. Enjoy a glass of wine as you stroll around the park, enjoying the sights and great elevated views. Don't miss the gardens below. Just walk down the steps.

Relax with a view. When exploring Lisbon and "Bairro Alto" you'll find this little park with a "miradouro". Time to stop at the cafe and grab something cold and relax watching over Lisbon. Great to view the sunset!

The View.... Upon reaching the stop of the funicular at the top...you will see miradouro Sao Pedro de alcantara.Here you can see the castle of sao jorge uphill,here you can enjoy looking part of lisbon by day or by night.You can also see also take a bit of your time to relax here at park & enjoy its scenery.
Breathtaking view for free!. The Miradouro São Pedro gives you the oportunity to have a great and breathtaking view. Totally worth the visit! And it is for free!!

Great views. Well worth the walk up - or take the tram if you feel you can't manage it.
Great views of the city - and a nice bar at the top - lovely to sit out in fine weather and admire the views
Great view, especially in the evening. Great view, seeing the lights on the Castle Soa Jorge area from this point. Great to enjoy with Port wine at the local kiosk.

Worth the hike. From Rossario Main line station, there is a series of steep steps that gets you to the centre of Bairro Alto. But I usually find that by the time I've reached to top I need some sort of resuscitation. Better get the funicular, I think which halves the pain. Once up there you have to visit here have a beer or Port and enjoy the view. It is superb. A must do!

A viewpoint. There are many places to view Lisbon and this is a good one looking across towards the Castle (which also offers good views). There is a little area here with a sort of garden from which you can view the City below but there is little to cause you to linger for very long

Nice outdoor stop on a Bairro walking tour. Magnificent views from a spacious park with trees and benches. Near restaurants and bars, stairway from the Rossio railway station-but that's quite a climb up.
Gorgeous view. What more is there to say? Easy to reach and not to miss on a Lisbon visit. And free so why hesitate?

Great views but the upstairs bar/kiosk sucks. Earlier today, three friends and I visited the upstairs bar/kiosk for snacks and a few drinks. The four of us are expats living in Lisbon, and had visited this kiosk previously on multiple occasions without incident. However, tonight we were charged for a bottle of wine we did not order, and when this error was brought to the manager's attention, he refused to discount the bill, threatened to call the police, and banned us from frequenting the kiosk in the future. To be clear, my friends and I legitimately ordered over 90 euro worth of food and drinks, so the issue wasn't an unwillingness or inability to pay. However, we were absolutely not going to pay an additional 20 euro for wine we did not order. Unfortunately, the server attending to us came to the end of his shift before we were ready to pay our bills, as he could have confirmed the legitimacy of our claim. Certainly the view from this location is wonderful, but based on my most recent experience with the upper level kiosk, I suggest visiting elsewhere for drinks and snacks. Thankfully, there are a variety of other options nearby and I doubt they will charge you unfairly.

lovely views of the city. can be accessed via the elevadore tramp, or a very steep walk from the rossio station. but the views on a clear day is amazing. almost all view points across lisbon are breathtaking!

BEST of all Miraduros in Lisbon! Why? Read on!. MUST DO the following:1. take the Escalada da Gloria (up hill tram) from bottom stop at Avenida de Liberdade - Lisbon's must do #1!2. go there in the evening, when the city's all lit up and street bands line up the top square. Goose skin guaranteed!3. than wander around the Bairro Alto district, with hundreds of restaurants to choose from!
Great views. Quiet, pretty place with amazing views over the city, the gardens are really beautiful. Either at day or night is totally worth going and enjoy the place

Great views. This Miradouro is right across the street from the hostel I stayed at. Even on a rainy day it was fun to wander around and look all the way down to the Tagus River. On sunny days there were artists, musicians and other types of entertainment happening.
Miradouro S.Pedro de Alcântara. Gorgeous! Really romantic, and beautiful. You can see Lisbon, and it's beautful. I strongly recommend it! It's worth the visit!!

Art nouveau landscape. Even if the Graca Miradouro is probably the best, this the most art nouveau landscape, because the streets of Bairro Alto are full of nice buildings and " azulejos " of this style

One of the best Miradouro. in my opinion is second best to the Miradoura Senhora do Monte, it has a very nice park and a fountain at the base! you can grab the funicular to get to it but only worth taking the funicular if you have the following options(on the spot is 3,.6 euro 2 rides)Buy the Lisbon card and you get also the trains for Cascais or Sintra covered.Buy the Viva Viagem card(0.5 euro) and get a day ticket 6 euro or a 3 day ticket 13,5 euro and ALL your transportation is covered,, including trams 28,18,12, 15 and the Santa Justa elevator which costs 5 euro!

Amazing view of the City.... The Miradoura Sao Pedro is certainly one of the best location to see the city in all perspective, facing the Castelo de Sao Jorge... you will enjoy the view, the scenery but also this area of Lisbon.

Very nice view and local shopping area near by. It is one of my favorite views in Lisbon. Since I stayed in the Bairro Alto it was pretty close by to walk uphill there. It's nice to sit there for a while and enjoy the view if it is not too touristy. There are also local shops nearby as I always support them wherever I travel.
One of "the views". The Miradouro de São Pedro de Alcântara, apart from being beautiful, has one of the great views of the city.

Nice area with nice view. We happened upon this place while on a walk in the vicinity, so stopped to take in the view to the river across the rooftops below. Nice gardens and a terrace where you can sit and wile away the hours, as you wish!

Good place to chill out with a glass of wine on a nice day.. After an informative but packed morning guided tour of some of the main attractions in Lisbon we took the funicular from The Avenida da Liberdade and took the few steps to this extensive terrace with its wide ranging views of Lisbon. These take in the river with a distant view of the bridge, and look over to the Castle, but more nearly down tom the Avenida and central district. On a hot day this was just the place to chill out with a glass of white wine listening to the buskers, including a very good jazz trio. We meant to go back in the evening to see the city lit up but never made it. One of the many reasons to come back to this city!

Came back here every night in Lisboa. Very nice garden, full of youngsters drinking and smoking - but everyone is very polite and friendly. Great view (but you very fast get used to them in Portugal). Nice atmosphere.
place to see. if you have the time walk around you see a lot more this way ,or buy metro ticket 6 Euros for day can hop on some of the bus with it

A great view and experience. This amazing place offer you a great view from Lisboa. Young people get together and have fun. You need to visit and realize the lively atmosphere. You can go in all seasons but in summer is very special.

One of the best views of Lisbon. This viewpoint possibly the biggest one it's also one of my favourite, here you can watch most of Lisbon's downtown and get some sun as well have a coffe on the nearby esplanada.

Nice to visit at night as well. We were here during the afternoon and the view was very nice. However it is not a lot different than other city vantage points. Went at night while waiting for a dinner at a nearby restaurant and thought it was much better. There are a lot of young people hanging out which makes it feel alive.You can get a drink in one o the restaurants across the street and then go to the park and just hang out.

Great View. It was worth the walk to get there. Lisbon is full of hills, but they offer various ways to conquer them: funicular trains, elevators, and tuk-tuks come to mind. We tried all three at different times and they each had their own charm (well, not the elevator - it was just an elevator, but it did take us up). Once you're up there, the view is really quite nice.

Best free attraction in Lisbon. Best way to spend some time in. It's really an open square, or plaza with one of the best views of Lisbon. You can sit on the bench and enjoy the view totally for free.

Good view over Lisbon. Nice view. Excellent place. Nice Port place across the street
Must use funicular : great experience when combined

Great view over the city. What a wonderful view over the city especially as the sun sets. Local musicians only added to the romantic setting. Visited on Friday and was popular with tourists & locals alike. Plenty of bars/restaurants available nearby.

Great views, good spot for taking a break from walking. Found this accidentally as we were heading for the Jardim Botanico. There was a musical group playing in the plaza near the cafe. Very enjoyable respite.

Viewpoint with live music. Nice place to stop for views of the city, shade and maybe a drink at a nearby cafe. Live music really sets the mood up, inviting you to stay for the rest of the afternoon. And you know what, that wouldn't be such a bad idea.
great view. During the night there are a lot of people(I was in a weekend) and it is a nice place. I climbed up to here but there is a tram and I guess a bus

Garden delight. Lisbon is full of tiny delights to entice the the more adventurous. Every where you go there are these tranquil paradises. Some only known to the locals. Get on your feet and walk the hills of Lisbon, it pays dividends.
Nice place. Great view especially in the dawn at the old town of Lisbon. There is always some live music and an open space bar invites for a drink if weather allows.

Breathtaking view all over town, plus Arrábida. Lots of space, very pretty to view sunrise. Can get very busy on friday and saturday nights!
You can have a great view all over Castelo de S. Jorge, also Terreiro do Paço and Sé.

At night overview in Lisboa. Even if tired, a stop, by night, in the neighborhood, watching the beautiful Lisbon at night leaves you breathless. Nearby the famous tram 26, awaits his new friends in their quest for Lisboa's discover. So take a brake during the day, or even better at night to plan your next day trip or just have a romantic walk. Loved it, hope you will too.
Go see!!. Although it does require some hiking to get to this viewpoint, it is totally worth it! An excellent overview of Lisabon!
Walking sightseeing. This was very good and a eye opiening experience worth the walk the views were fab part of our day in Lisbon
Brilliant Views. Brilliant views with plenty of space to sit down. Easy to access from the city centre. Plenty of restaurants nearby
Best overall Miradouro!. Off all the Viewpoints we visited and we saw most, this one was the best! It's got everything, view, 2 big terrace''s, tree's for shade and 2 nice bars.

very special at night!. Why not 5 stars? well there is always the risk of pickpoquets while one marvels at the view...Bairro Alto is close by, which adds to the interest at night. The S. Roque church and its museum are also around the corner, you'll have to go there during the day then.

Excellent views, good kiosk cafe, lovely gardens. I really liked this Miradouro, just up from Avenida Liberdade, next to the Elevador da Gloria and near to Chiado and the Bairro Alto. The gardens are very lovely for a stroll, with pretty flowers and fountains. Nice to stop for a drink, day or evening, at the kiosk and just take in the views across the city to the castle. Spacious and open, very pleasant.
Amazing spot. one of the most beautiful scenery you can see the other side of Lisbon with the castle at the top of the mountain. You can't miss this spot ..very close to Bairo Alto. Recommended

180 degrees of Lisbon. This is one of the top spots in Lisbon to get a great view as well as a nice rest from sightseeing. You get a 180º of Lisbon since it sits at the top of one of the seven hills. The small garden is a perfect place to recover your energy with a coffee bar and esplanade.Not to be missed.

A memorable stop on a self guided walking tour Lisbon. We returned to Lisbon with a limited time for visiting and walked the city--this is one of the visual highlights of a pleasurable walking tour--Lisbon is hilly which creates memorable vistas such as this one!

Lovely Gardens,Great view, Appalling Kiosk. A lovely place to spend an afternoon or evening with an impressive view of Lisbon.If your looking for a place for a relaxing glass of wine I don't recommend the kiosk by the gardens. I heard a lady ask for a white coffee and the waiter replied in a nasty and patronising tone.'we're not racist here my lady, we say coffee with milk'His attitude to her was terrible.The lady quite rightly went to complain about him in the kiosk but no one looked botheredWhen she explained how upset she was by his behaviour, he lust laughed and said'Your getting upset over nothing' and walked off.He then came up to me to take an order to which I replied'It's a lovely place, shame that someone like you spoils it' and walked away.Miradouro de Santa Luzia on the other side is an equally lovely view with and their kiosk had very friendly staff and made a fine sangria.

Lovely garden and view. This miradoura is a beautiful little area, spoiled somewhat by graffiti but not enough to take away the joy of discovering it. It is easy to find, just take the funicularacross the street from the Condes building (Hard Rock cafe) and it is immediately on your right. Take some time to explore this region further. Bairro Alto also has the impressive Sao Roque church and so many charming streets.

Nice view, I guess a must see in Lisbon. A nice place, with the nice view. Relaxing point which should be included in your walking tour around the places with the best views on Lisbon. Be aware, not much shadow, could be killing on a sunny day.
Lovely.. Along with all of Lisbon's miradors, this is not to be missed. Immediately to your right at the top of the funicular.

Beautiful spot to relax and enjoy the view. Beautiful little park with great views and a small cafe. Relax in one of the park benches or get a coffee and chill out in one of the cafes recliners enjoying the view of Lisbon

Gorgeous views. This was a beautiful area to enjoy a sunny day, plenty of views, restaurants, and people...You can spend an afternoon walking around the area and visiting little shops for wine, porto, or to sample food, art. This area is full of culture.

Fabulous view, especially in the afternoon. Great view, especially in the afternoon, because of the sunlight. You see:
- Castello de São Jorge
- Se Catedral
- Sea
And a lot of other beautiful buildings.
Beautiful!. Beautiful views from this location with lots of picture taking opportunities! Great to view the sunset!
great and close to the city. a short stepp walk to this ... or take the tram...lol the street art on the way to this site is excellent, then you get the view

One of the great free views of Lisbon. . We stayed on Avenida street. Once you spot the side street (to your right if you're walking down the street), head up the hill (we walked every time but we're young and fit) which is steep but we didn't find it a challenge at all. Once you get to the top take a right and just up ahead you'll be greeted with a lively park with one permanent bar and few make shift portable bars and of course a great overview of the city. Then make your way down the hill and to your right is the lively barrio alto area, an area I'm quite fond of.
Breathtaking sights. Wonderfull breathtaking sights of the whole city. Close to the busy district of bairro alto famous for the nightlife, fado shows and trendy artsy shops.
a Must. One of Lisbon best views. There is also a bar on the terrace that is extremely pleasant on a sunny afternoon.

The more you see Lisbon the more you love it. Another view of Lisbon, it is a lovelly city and you never get tired to see its diferente views, either during the day or the nigth.
Easy to reach

Very nice view on Lisboa. Elevador Gloria takes you right here siu it will be probably be the second place you will visit in Lisbon. Wonderfull view on the castle and the city. Barrio alto starts from here. Take the Bica elevator by goind forward towards the opposite way that you would see when looking on the city. You will also cross the path of tram 28.

a must. Get there from the Restauradores square by the Elevador da Gloria (1 minute ride) or on foot (a few minutes up a steep hill). Your effort will be rewarded by great views. There is a small cafe where you can buy something to drink.
Beautiful Lisboa. If you re looking for amazing views of this beautiful city, this Miradouro is a must. Don t forget your camera!
A great view by day or night. Amazing panaramic view of the city as a whole. Small cafe nearby with musicians plying their trade. Ideal starting or finishing point for a long night ahead.

Great view over Lisbon hills. This terrace is a great place to take The Photo of Lisbon as it captures all the great monuments in the river frontline near the city centre: the castle, the cathedral, Graça's Convent, Senhora do Monte Terrace and all the old eighteenth and nineteenth century buildings of Avenida da Liberdade. You'll find it amazing. You also can shop around in the beautiful street shops nearby either you continue to Príncipe Real garden to visit the Natural History Museum or down through Rua do Alecrim to Chiado or even lower to Cais do Sodré. For a total experience go to the Lost in Esplanada, another great terrace oever Lisbon. They have jazz session live music on thursdays. Rua D.Pedro V Nº56-D

View and people watch. Super lookout over Lisbon on edge of Bairro Alto. Great place to watch the sun go down and see sights of the city. Handy for going on Gloria and the port wine institute. But best part is just watching people enjoying themselves in a lovely location.

great view over lisbon. the is one of the several miradouros /view points of the city. it's pretty fast to get there, however not easy. you can take Gloria's elevator, which is actually a funicular, for 3.6 EUR round trip, or you can climb up the street for 15 min. be careful, the street it very steep and pebbled with those types of shinny pebbles that are everywhere around lisbon. how they do it when it rains i have no idea!the view from up is very beautiful. make sure you go in the afternoon so that the sun lights the river, castle and all eastern part of lisbon.
Great Views. Good spot to view the City and the Castle, great if you want to take panoramic photos. Come up on the Elevador De Santa Justa (funicular railway) and take it all in. Super at night too.

Stuning view of the castle and the downtown. This is one of the best sightseeing spots in Lisbon, i visited it after the underground tour in the Lisbon Aqueduct! Coming out from beneath the ground and having this stunning view is... wonderful! Had a cold drink in the outdoor café: delicious!

One of the best miradouros. We went here accidentally while looking for something else and stood there for an hour ore more enjoying the beautiful view over Lisbon. You can easily get here with Metro to Baixa-Chiado and than walk about 700m or with the tram from praqua restauradores.

Nice view. This is a pleasant miradouro in lovely settings with a fountain and a little park to relax in. The view is very good as it shows the castle and much of Lisbon, however out of all the miradouros I have seen, this was not one of my favourites.Still, it is in a great location at the top of the Elevador da Gloria and near Bairro Alto, so is therefore easily accessible and you do not need to go far out of the way to come here and won't take much out of your day if you are only visiting the city for a short time.

Amazing view over the city. From there, you'll see most of Lisbon. Alfama (Sé and castelo S. Jorge), avenida da Liberdade, Graça and the Tagus river. It's better in the afternoon because in the morning you'll be facing the sun. It can be very touristy at Sunset and even at night but the view is very beautiful.
Outstanding view. The view is splended, e ahd breakfast in the little garden too and tha was nice to. As good as you will get at some hotels. Steep clib up or take the elevator. Then enjoy the views.

Worth it. We went here to meet my cousins at nighttime and I could imagine the beauty of this place when the sun is setting. At night it is special to Lisbon all lit up. It is a great place to take your date or enjoy a sunset with your sweetheart. The views are spectacular shouting across the city. its well worth to plan an evening here and then head out to the bar scene.
Lovely view . A wonderful view to the city of Lisbon.You can get amazing pics and relax in the garden after sightseeing.

Stunning view. A pleasant garden from which you can have a great view over Lisbon, the City, the hills, S. Jorge (Saint George) Castle and the river Tagus. It's near Bairro Alto, where you can find lots of restaurants, bars and discos.Just sit and have a rest under a tree, listening to the twittering of birds and enjoy the view!
Wonder Lisbon. Awsome views of the city, awsome place to chill and and take pictures. Recomend that to everyone who comes to Lisbon !
Great views!. One of the best, and most inexpensive, views over the city. Definitely worth a visit as very central and easy to reach.
One of the best "miradouros". A must go to see the views over our beautiful city. Recently renewed, now it also has a small cafe where you can have some drink while enjoying the view.

Nice Visit by Funicular to Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara. You will find this at the top of the Gloria funicular this two-level park offers great views over the city the Castle Sao Jorge and the River Tagus. You can travel on this funicular for 3.60 Euro or free if you have the Carris 6 Euro day pass that covers all Lisbon Transport or take the short uphill walk on the funicular route.. This is a great place to be in the mid to late afternoon as you will have the sun at your backs as you look out over the city. A good photo opportunity with plenty of places to eat and drink. Buskers playing and artists selling really nice paintings and tiles etc.From here you can wander downhill through Bairro Alto to Chiado with nice shops etc.If this review is helpful then please indicate so below.

Great views. Fantastic views from the viewing point, there was a good atmosphere with some local musicians playing some cheerful music, we were able to sit and have a drink with fantastic views of the city. Would be good to combine with Alfama and the castle and tram 28.

Lovely View in Evening as Sun goes down.. We came across this place by chance as it was a few minutes walk from our apartment. Nice view in the daytime of the red rooftops towards the Castelo St George. But even better in the evening as the sun goes down and the lights come on. There are benches near to the railings and a kiosk bar with tables and chairs. Also a very pretty ornamental garden with old style lamps. I only did three of the Miradouros but this was the best in my view, and a lovely place to relax for a while.
Worth it. Excellent views over the city, you cab taje the funicular to get to the top, using the daily pass , otherwise its not cheap.Lot of people, but not very crowded, fantastic look into Lisbon.

Lisbon at your feet. Two level viewing point. You have a wonderful view on Tagsu River, Avenida Liberdade, Cathedral Se, and Saint George Castle too. The lower level is full of statues, on the upper level a statue of Eduardo Coelho, who was founder of a newspaper. A nice fountain is also here at the upper level. But the main reason to come and see, this the the view.
Fantastic view of the city. great views of the castle. Lovely place to sit. Just at the top of the Gloria elevator. Orientation board to help identify points of interest.
Great view point. A great viewpoint to see the city, there're some kiosks nearby so u can spend your whole afternoon there with a great view n some drinks.

Alcántara Miradouro. Superb view! Take a little picnic, some chilled Vinho Verde and enjoy the early evening view on the Tagus, the 25 April Bridge...the ferries and sailboats...the city's roof tops...

The most romantic view of Lisbon and St Jorges Castle. It shows Lisbon from its best point and it is great to look at the Castle and Alfama and Rossio with Bairro Alto and buzz behind the Gardens and the statue of the real life size of a Lisbon boy newspaper seller
Breathtaking view over the city. Excellent view over the city and river. Lot of room to have a seat and now also with a small coffee kiosk.

Our first evening in Lisboa & we found this magic place. Our first evening in Lisboa & we found this magic place. The views over Lisboa are fantastic. There were market stalls selling bric-a-brac, food, clothing bags etc. An elderly man was giving free tap dance classes. The cafe was very busy with a race for a table or for take aways. There was an area with music where people were dancing their time away. We returned here on a few journeys back to our apartment.
Worth a visit. Beautiful views of the city. From here you can see from the top the St. George's castle and water. Buy a coffee, sit, and relax!
Lovely views. Stunning views across to the Castle, nice garden with bar facilities. Quieter than some other Miradour's, especially at night, but the castle at night is the attraction.

Always a great stop before heading into Bairro Alto for drinks. Stop here for views over the Castle, not that Lisbon is shy of viewing points. I always stop here for an expresso in the gardens before making my way to the busy bars of bairro alto.

Peaceful and Pleasant. A chilling space with a cracking little cafe used by tourists and locals alike with spectacular views of the city, it's easily accessible from Principe Real and via tram from Avenida Liberation it can be windy however the cafe will provide a shawl to keep you snug. Don't hesitate to visit and while away the hours.
What a view !!!. Excellent place for morning coffee due to great view and relaxed athmosphere. Is easy to reach by tram, but also walking from Avenida metro station

perfect view with relaxing atmosphere. I enjoyed wide view on Lisbon, at small but peaceful park. When I got there, a street musician sing a song wth playing a guitar. This music also provided relax with spring breeze and shine.

Wonderfully picturesque views. Splendid views of the central parts of the city including Castelo de São Jorge. Seemingly a a popular place among the locals as well as tourists, the terrace attracts local artists and musicians who contribute to the atmosphere. The garden itself isn't huge but there are lots of benches - given the time, one could easily spend a couple of hours here with a newspaper or a book. Just don't forget to bring a camera. :)

Perfect spot for views of Lisbon. This popular kiosk has a menu for light lunch items and snacks and a full bar. It is a lovely place to rest after a day walking the hills of Lisbon. Popular with locals and tourists, you may have to wait for a table. But there is a to-go window if you prefer to eat and drink on a park bench.

The nicest view of Lisbon. A stop at the Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantra, with a fresh orange juice and a pastel, is the best way to feel the quite buzz coming from the city. A calm contemplation of its inner qualities.

Tip: Take the metro to Rato, and walk downhill to enjoy the fantastic views here!!!. With picturesque views of the city, this is undoubtedly one of the best miradouros in Lisbon (and free of course!). It is a great place to people watch, and from mid-afternoon, you will have the sun behind you, as you enjoy the fantastic views. There are plenty of places to enjoy refreshments, along with numerous artists selling local artwork. My advice would be to take the metro to Rato Metro Station, and from there walk downhill to Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara. Much easier that way, without arriving completely exhausted... enjoy!

Great view. This is one of the best known miradouros of Lisbon and gives a good view on the castle and Baixa. Nevertheless, always very crowded and a little dirty (for Lisbon-terms). One of the best things to do here is get yourself a take-away box of Sushi at the sushi-place nearby and sit on one of the picnic tables. Remember to bring a bottle of wine and you have a perfect evening! Watch your bag/pockets!!

Quiet park with terrific views, very relaxing, with cafe.. You can sit on the fountain, or down below in the park, or up on the terrace, or in the cafe.. mixed people, nice spot, even with locals and kids. Fun to go up to with the cable car and then onward up to the barrio alto!

Stunning Views over Lisboa. Don't miss this beautiful Miradouro when you're in the Biarro Alto neighbourhood, its simply stunning. Beautiful little park, plenty of benches to rest your weary calf muscles (if you've walked up like we had), there's usually someone with a guitar there singing their heart out, adding to the mood. Enjoy the fabulous views over Lisboa and the castle, you won't regret it!
Stunning views . Just breathtaking views of Lisbon city. Pleasant park and lovely time spent with friends. Well worth a visit you will be just amazed at the beauty of the city
Breathtaking. First time in there, I was trully amased by the view! Incredible! Think it is better than Graça Miradouro. If you are visiting Bairro Alto, dont miss ir!!

You wouldn't expect a view like that!. I stayed just across the park from this "miradouro" and didn't know it was there. I just expected view points somewhere higher in the city, however, if you're visiting Bairro Alto, don't miss this small park with a breathtaking view.
Wonderful city view. It's well located, with a wonderful view, places to drink something and benches to seat and watch the view or read a nice book

Nice view over the old city and the castle. This square offers a view over the old city and is situated opposite the castle. It is usually quite full of tourists and street musicians. Unfortuntely its walls are full of tags and the lower part of the square is rather dirty.

The finest view to Castelo de S. Jorge. Castelo de S. Jorge dominates Lisbon's landscape. It's a classic and with large merit. To take a good look at it and cover also a good portion of one of Lisbon hills, you must pay a visit to Miradouro de São Pedro de Alcântara. As the garden is medium sized and it is fresh and beautiful, I invite you to carry with you a good lot of newspapers and a book and enjoy your stay for a few hours. It will pay you back for sure.

Super views and orange juice. Lovely atmosphere at this Miradouro with super views. The café serves great freshly pressed orange juice.
The area around the funicular base station to take you there was marred by graffiti - a problem in many areas of Lisbon.
Excellent view - maybe the best. Our tour guide took us to this area to take pictures. It has a great view. You can see a great part of the city from this area,

take the funicular. Don't go to the burger hill place at the top!!!!!
Lovely views! We took the funicular up from the main street using our 24hour cassis card (such a bargain). Good place to start a stroll around Bairro Alto or up to the Botanical Gardens:

2nd best mirador in town. In terms of panoramic views, this one is the 2nd best after the mirador in Alfama. The views are nice but you don't get as much detail and color as in Alfama. I believe this mirador was featured in the movie "night train to Lisbon"

Wonderfull vue of Lisbon. A place to visit and to have a wonderfull vue of Lisbon Donwtown with the Castle, and all the historic center. Near there is Solar do Vinho do Porto, where you can taste some of the best Oporto wines!
Excellent view of the city!. Top-top view point if you want to see the whole city and the castle along with the river side. Must visit in Lisbon.

Great place to sit and take in the view or a drink. At the top of the Gloria funicular this two-level park offers great views over the city. There are places to sit in sun and shade, and a kiosk serving beers, coffees, small snacks, etc. Popular for photo-taking or just sitting or strolling. Worth the climb (or the extortionate fee for the funicular).
Gorgeous view. Gorgeous view of the castel and downtown. Very well kept with little bars and fountains! Love it. Take a cab or transport because it's pretty hard to park you car
Great view!. One of the best views of the city! So easy to get to, I went in the morning and evening, It's even better at sunset!

Simply beautiful!. What a place, what a view. Such fantastic vista of part of the city of Lisbon with River Tagus in background. Tea and coffee kiosks around. Ride up the place in tram and enjoy the absolutely marvellous view.

Beautiful park. Such a beautiful park by our hotel! We came here after having breakfast and took in the views, the lush gardens and the play area for the kids. I enjoyed it, because in the midst of chaos and rowdy city streets, stands this place where it's serene and just beautiful. A nice mix of the city and garden in one. I wished we got to stay longer, because we had to go on a tour and stumbled upon this place. Definitely a nice stop for a picnic.

Beautiful view. In March, around 4 PM, there always was a beautiful view of the city and the Castelo Sao Jorge. It is a nice view point of the Castle and the sea, and there is a small counter for drinks. On nice days, the light is beautiful and there was a guy playing music.

Cocktails with amazing view. Went to the Kiosk (Quisque) at this miradouro and bought a Caipirinha and a Porto Tónico with my daughter, with a fabulous view of all Lisbon, including the Castelo de Sao Jorge (St George's Castle)

great views of the city, nice place to sit & chill. with sweeping views of the town looking east towards the Castle this is a great place to be in the mid to late afternoon as you will have the sun at your backs as you look out over the city. Plenty of places to eat and drink, buskers and artists selling paintings etc.

Indeed a Great View. I would say this was just as good as any of the other viewpoints around Lisbon. They all show the same center core and great panoramic. My wife and I were just walking by here on the way to the water museum so it was definitely a nice surprise but I didn't think it was that much better than the view from St. George's castle.

Another awesome view of Lisbon. An hipster area with an amazing view over Lisbon Tagus River. Sit down if the grass, grab a beer and enjoy the random music portuguese imigrants play in this beautiful place

Excellent view. As others have said, one of the better viewpoints in Lisbon, with a nice little park and a café. Best reached by the funicular from Restauradores. The tile-panel guide to the skyline is quaint but sadly out-of-date!

One of the best Miradouros. This Miradouro is great as it also has some park / gardens on top of the great great great view. The atmosphere is great an we stayed quite late although I would be more careful if alone, especially if you are a girl (sadly) as it is not completely visible from the street. As usual with Lisbon sights, worth the walk!

miradoura. Lovely view,use the funicular to get up there and take plenty of pics. After go on the pavement at the rear and down the slope is the Instituto dos vinhos do porto. Read about it elsewhere, that alone is worth the trip.

Beautiful view over the city.... If you go to the Miradouro de Sao Pedro de Alcantara you will have one of the beutiful view over the city of Lisbon... definitely worth the visit.. If you do not want to walk to the miradouro you can get the Elevador da Gloria that departs from Praca dos Restauradores and have a different transport experience...

Nice place to see Lisbon in evening. We went here during sunset time.
It is a nice place to see overall Lisbon city from here.
You can see Castelo de Sao Jorge also in other side.
The best way to come here is by using the famous Elevador da Glori from town around Restauradores metro.
From here you can go enjoying Bairro Alto area.
the best spot. one of the best spots in lisboa! you can sit here and enjoy a lovely view over this awesome city. get a drink and sitting here in the evening. but be careful

Lovely Viewpoint. Found this viewpoint by chance after riding on the Elevador da Gloria. Lovely views across to the casle. The viewpoint has two levels of gardens with benches and the upper level also has a small food/drink stall.

Beautiful. I stumbled upon this overlook after dinner when i was wandering around Lisbon to take night photographs. It provides an amazing view over the city with a fantastic view of the castle, especially at night. Nearby there is a small garden terrace, beautiful fountain and one of the neat trams to take you up and down the step hill, where you can get a view of Lisbon's modern urban art gallery. A neat site to see as well. One of my favorite parts of Lisbon. Safe travels!

Perfect view!!!!. One of the best views in Lisbon!! Unlimited view in the castle of Sao Jorge and the downtown center! Many benches to sit and relax, especially in the summer, autumn and spring times, Also a very nice quiosque to sit and have a nice drinl. Enjoy

Wonderful Place to Relax. This is one of the nicest lookouts in Lisbon. It's set up in two tiers and both are dotted with benches, so there is plenty of space to sit down and relax. On the upper level, there is a small snack bar. This lookout is close to Barrio Alto, a happening neighbourhood in the evenings, so if you come here in the evenings or weekends, expect lots of activity and large groups of young people singing and playing guitar. The view of St.George Castle is magnificent and the river is visible as well, so it makes for a very nice photograph. One may bring some picnic or wine here and just sit and enjoy the view. Very lovely. There is a funicular very close by, so one can take it up and end up close to the lookout. Because of the lights around St. George Castle at night, this lookout is even nicer in the evening - go both during the day and in the evening if you can. I've attached a few photos taken from this lookout. For more photos, you can see my entire Lisbon album at: https://www.flickr.com/photos/little_baklava/sets/72157648122958913/

Fantastic views!. Beautiful viewing point, definitely worth a visit for sunset. Cafe where you can order a delicious hot chocolate or giant gin & tonic!!! They have other beverages but they were my favourite! Bring your camera!
Perfect Viewpoint. Classic view from Bairro Alto over the city to the Sao Jorge Castle. Worth the climb or take the funicular.

One Of THE BEST Panoramic views. One of my ultimate favorite views and a great place to kick back for a coffee or cappuccino and gaze ahead at the gorgeous hues before your eyes .Don't forget the lower level and while in the neighborhood, hook a ride downtown on the trolley. .historic and fun!!

Great view, many benches. This is a great view for a picnic. Large viewing area, many benches, and if you're lucky, a guitar player. Buy some bellota, cheese, and olives at the Mercato Ribeira, bread at a panadeira, and enjoy lunch with a beautiful sunny view.

Great view for free!. It has a great view of the eastern part of the city: castle and old town. I went there at sunset but I found out that with the castle in the way I won't see the sunrise so I went down to Cais de Sodre and from there is was amazing. This miradouro is a good place to see the city at daylight!
