nice view. really nice view and very easy to reach the place if you go up Bairro Alto, its also very near to Pavilhão da China, a tea house full of little collections from china and other places
One of the mirador of Lisbon. If you are visiting Lisbon, a must to do is probably to pass by most of city's mirador. To me, this one is the best.

Amazing views. This is one of the great place to have a view over Lisbon. Nice café nearby for a rest. From here you can see the St. Jorge Castle, the “Baixa” (as they call it) and the Liberdade avenue all the way up to the Eduard the 7th parquet. A really nice place to go to.

One of the best views of Lisbon!. Great views, what more can be said? You can see the city and the water as well. Very beautiful. Gives you a great panoramic vista. You can see many of the cathedrals and the castle as well.

Great view. lovely little garden, two levels, with great view on the castle, on the Miradouros of Graça, and of Sra do Monte.And a viés on town and the Tejo. Great kiosque.Surroundings are interesting.

One of Lisbon's great views.. At the top of the cable car. Very lovely. Next to teeming and very cool Bairo Alto. Acts as the front yard and garden for the great Independente Hostel & Boutique Hotel. Very romantique spot.
Another great view. Another place that offers a great view of Lisbon. With some much to offer the view are great. Best on a nice sunny day
Wonderful. You have some nice view of the Baixa (Downtown) and can also have a coffee or a ginja (portuguese cherry licquor). It's really a nice place and not overcrowded by tourists.
Beautiful views. Just beautiful views during the day and night. Lovely walk through little streets, lovely architecture.

Lisbon at your feet. Wonderful place to see the ancient Lisbon in the popular Bairro Alto district where you can find lots of Restaurants and Bars. The place was renewed a year ago and as a lot of animation with music and a nice coffee shop to get a warm snack, now that is almost winter.

Great view over lisbon and Tejo river. You have a great view from part of Lisbon and Tejo river in front of view. Very calm , relaxing and wonderful place for 30m to appreciate the beauty all around.It is a very nice sightseeing place in Lisbon. One of the best in mine opinion (but are more !).You have a esplanade and a small bar around where you can buy a beer and ... enjoy the view for the next half hour.Must visit it.
garden with a view of the lisbon city!. The Glória Funicular at Restauradores Square (Restauradores metro station) took us directly to this place. Beautiful garden with a view of the entire city!
Absolutely Gorgeous. Beautiful views of Lisbon. There's also a lower level with benches to relax, have a snack and enjoy the views.
beautiful view. take a walk there, or go by the funicular it´s a beautiful view over the city, and the castle on the other side

Good city view. I have been there many times while that year when I was living in Lisbon for one year, it's a nice city view, you can also go there on weekend evening to enjoy some drinks with your friends, 'cos drinking on the street is totally legal in Lisbon, specialy sunset time might really nice :)
Marvellous. This is absolutely my favourite one in lisbon!!! Good either you're with some friends drinking beer or alone reading a book during a lazy afternoon
A must!. Definitely one of the best places in the city for me. Amazing view of the castle, the cathedral and the river, and right next to Bairro Alto. Has a lovely garden to enjoy the sun in.
great views. on a clear day, can get a great view of sao jorge castle, the tejo river, and baixa. close to a lot of sights like sao roque chuch, port wine institute, cafe trinidade.
lovely. This is next to our hotel.We came up here several times.Very pleasant. Safe and clean with a view of the old city.Nice cafes and restaurants nearby.

Lisbon in my Hand. A great place to see a big part of the Lisbon beauty. The Castle in front and down town approaching the river Tagus. No to forget and take a chance to visit Bairro Alto and Principe Real.
Good views of Baixa and Alfama. Good views of Baixa and Alfama from Chiado. Not far from night restaurants and bars and Campo Real shops.
Great view BUT.... Geat view Lisbon BUT it is overcrowded and touristy and there are a few ugly new warehouse type buildings in the foreground which spoil the view a bit.

Lisbon Does This So Well.... ...Sitting little parks at well judged vantage points over the City. This a small area on two levels shaded with trees, serenaded by a fountain and amply provided with benches. The view during daytime is splendid and even better after dark. There is a small cafe with prices a tad above average.

Fantastic place, amazing view!. To get to the Miradouro you have the option of using the Gloria Elevator or, if you prefer, you can climb on foot. Either way, you will be presented with a gorgeous view of Lisbon, a peaceful small garden with benchs to relax, and a very picturesque atmosphere. The only downside (that didn't spoiled the fun) are the souvenirs sellers that are sometimes inconvenient and insistent. Apart of that, just be aware of pickpockets, specially on the Elevator.
Nice view. Nice view, nothing much to do though. I preferred the views from the other side of the town. It makes an intereting pictures, but you basically see just loads of roofs.

Need to see it during the night. It`s a great place to start your walk through Chaido and Bairo Alto, also it really beautiful during the evening and the night, you can see Alfama, the river, and the newest parts of Lisbon too.

Scenic spot, perfect for downtime. I was lucky enough to be staying at the hostel just across the street, so I spent lots of time in the park admiring the views of the city below. Perfect spot to read, people watch and just relax after a long day of sightseeing. Grab some coffee (or wine) from the on-site (slightly overpriced) cafe and enjoy some fado from the performers who call the park their stage.
Great view. A small park near Bairro Alto with a grewat view over Lisbon where you can seat and relax, near the nightlife.

Great photo opportunity with wonderful views of Lisbon.. Perfectly positioned around halfway between Marques de Pombal and downtown Lisbon, take a coffee or a beer and relax for a while while looking out over the city. The funicular runs down from here too. Great pictures to be had from the balcony and the gardens are delightful.
This is a nice place for a good view.. This is a nice place for a good view and it's free. You can sit down on a bench and you can listen to the streetmusic.

Nice little Square, take the Gloria Funicular. There are several ways to get to this Square containing the Miradour. We opted to take the Gloria Funicular which is opposite the square from the Hard Rock Cafe (pay the driver, approx 3 euros each way). The tram runs every 15-20 minutes. There are 2 funiculars and only 2 stops. If one funicular is at the top, the other is at the ground level.There are cafes and restaurants at the top. We arrived at 10 am so many of the eateries were still closed. There are many park benches on both the tree-shaded upper level and the garden-like lower level to sit and enjoy the views.

Romantic. Beautiful view. Must be even more romantic in the evening. Many restaurants on the hill! The tram takes you up the hill as it is very steep but don't both paying for it as it is not worth it. We had a travel card that's why we hoped on. But it is maybe a 15 min walk but a 2 min tram ride (waste of money really)
Amazing view over the city!. Nice spot in Lisbon, offers you an amazing view over the city! Next to some of the best restaurants in Lisbon and Bairro Alto, famous for its bars and clubs.

Lovely peaceful views a stones throw from central bairro alto bars. Lovely view, right round teh corner from our apartment in central Bairro Alto. I wouldnt necessarily trek here form the other side of the city, but if in the neighbourhood I would stay a little longer to catch the view at dusk or at night. The bars on neighbouring streets do take away cocktails so grab one and bring it with you! There is also a cafe here serving drinks and snacks til late.
Panoramic view. Wonderful guitarist singing while we admired the view! We had been walking for miles so it was a great place to stop and rest...

Great View even in the Rain. My friend and I climbed up to this view point on a rather overcast evening, but the view was still pretty spectacular and there were a good number of people. There is a nice little garden and lots of places to take a load off after climbing up the massive hill (if you didn't take the Elevador da Gloria up).

Great view of the city. Really nice view point of the city. There are numerous cafes nearby where you can grab a beer, sit at the stairs and enjoy an amazing sunset on lisboa. You get a great view of the sea and the alfama area.
View of Alfama. Sensational views of the Alfama and the baixa areas. Also a nice cafe to relax with the view and people watch.

Best viewpoint of lisbon. For everyone who visits lisbon.This is probably the best viewpoint of Lisbon. Very beautiful in indeed. Go by food ( a lot of stairs but again an experience on its own ) - or take of one the 2 famous elevators You can drink here also here a beer for 1 euro a beer. There are also some lounge chairs.BE AWARE FOR PICKPOCKETS & PEOPLE WHO WANT TO TALK WITH YOU. They are all after your money...
A beautifull view. Worthwhile to go there and enjoy the beautifull view of Lisbon. Bring your camera. Go downstairs to enjoy the beuatifull peacefull garden too..
nice view. was very nice experience, nice view you can see from the Miradouro, we took the Gloria elevator is a small tranway, tipical from Portugal, wonderful sunset, incredible collors ....

Beautiful Views. There are a few ways to get up to the Miradouro, but the nicest is to walk from the Baixa / Chiado areas passing through the lovely neighbourhoods and stopping every now and then for a coffee or a beer or just to watch the world go by. Definitely worth the effort to get there and if you cant make the walk back down hill, the tram is right next door.
The best karma do end the day. As I was staying not far from this, it became a ritual after a day of exploring, as the sun set over this amazing city, tranquility all round,  I miss it now.

Pretty! Free view of the City!. We stumbled upon this by accident after viewing the city from the Santa Justa Elevator. This was so much better because it was free and you did not have to wait in line. I wish I had seen this first! It is a nice place to take a break and eat a pastry!
Great viewpoint of the city. Great place to understand the layout of the city and see an overview of the city. The area around the viewpoint is also fun for shopping.

Where to start your evening at cosmopolitan Lisbon. This is a belvedere, a garden and certainly the right place to start your evening at Lisbon's ebullient quarter of "Bairro Alto", where restaurants, cafés and discos complete the scene. But, the "Miradouro São Pedro de Alcântara" can be visited at any time. Beautiful, manicured and shaded gardens, with attractive benches, are an invitation to self reflection and peaceful thoughts. At sunset, the magical moments of seeing Lisbon's lights being turned on. Amazing! Lovely views of the quarters of "Graça" and "São Vicente de Fora", as well as of the "Castelo de São Jorge", with the scenic lighting of its walls. Enjoy!
Mandatory Lisbon view point.. In the hill in front of the castle and of other marvelous view-point (Senhora do Monte). Contemplation.
Peace Heaven. Excellent view all all hours of the day, if you want to go end of afternoon stop at the refreshment stall at the back and enjoy one of the Mojito or Caipirinha, you will not regret it.
Nice view. Great view on all Lisbon, meeting place for Bairro Alto bars. You could buy drinks on Bairro Alto and drink it on this nice miradouro.
Stunning. This is a really good place to relax grab a coffee and enjoy the views over the city, especially after walking up so many steep hills.

Wanted to stay there for a while.... We visited Elevador da Bica and Miradouro Santa Catarina where we had a coffee and walked afterwards though Bairro Alto to Rue Sao Pedro da Alcantara to Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara. This Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara is even better than the Santa Caterina view.The park at the Miradouro is a wonderful setting. There is a detailed tile map displaying what you are looking at from the park's perspective.

Pretty!. Great views and we bought a lovely painting from an artist there too. We walked up a different way rather than take the elevator and it wasn't too hard a walk. It's also a nice spot to sit for a minute and relax after a lot of exploring in Lisbon.

Take a break in this beautiful place. Everytime a friend comes to visit Lisbon, this is the place we go before heading to Bairro Alto. Has an amazing view and it's the perfect spot to take grab a drink and take a break from the lively nightlife.

Great Views!. We rode the Santa Justa Elevator to the Bairro Alto and walked by the Convento de Carmo ruins (1755 earthquake). We then continued our walk to the Sao Roque church and then to Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara. A nice walk to get to wonderful views of Lisbon, the Cathedral and the Castle across the valley. The park at the Miradouro is a wonderful setting. There is a wonderfully detailed tile map displaying what you are looking at from the park's perspective. The map itself is a work of art! We took the Gloria elevator back down to complete our Bairro Alto stroll.
Great views. Take the Elevator da Gloria up and walk over to Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara. Good views across Lisbon.

Amazing view!. The "Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara", was built in the nineteenth century, it´s one of the most emblematic sights of the city, reopened totally renovated in February 2008. It´s situated close to Bairro Alto and overlooking the Avenida da Liberdade, offers one of the most beautiful panoramas of the city of Lisbon.Here you can see an amazing view of Lisbon! Very romantic at night!
The best view of Lisbon. Fantastic gem that allows you to overlook the best marks of the Lisbon history. Specially beautiful at night.
Worth climbing :). Worth climbing :) But there also other nicer miradouros in town. If you like effort - do it for the fun of it.
Nice view. Nice view, you can see the city, castle ... and for free. After thant you can visit the Chiado and Bairro Alto
view to a kill. Great views on to the castle, river and downtown Lisbon. Nice to see both during the day and the night. Get the using Elevador da Gloria.

Amazing view over Lisbon. It's in the centre of the city. You'll have an amazing view to Castelo de Sao Jorge. It's near Bairro Alto and the historical centre of Lisbon. Nothing more to say. You'll get to it the moment you start wondering around Lisbon. Plenty of people around, kids playing and musicians also playing music in Miradouro.

Uau! Lisbon is a delight :-). This sightseeing spot is really nice. Beautiful view over Lisbon downtown and also to other colines and to Castelo Sao Jorge... But it also ... the entrance to Bairro Alto! Lisbon is a delight :-)

Great view. The Miradouro de São Pedro de Alcântara is a belvedere in Lisbon with a beautiful garden, the Jardim António Nobre. From here you have fine views over large parts of Lisbon.From the miradouro you have excellent views over the area, including the Baixa district, the area around the Avenida da Liberdade and the Tagus river. A funicular - the Elevador da Glória - connects the garden with the lower situated Restauradores Square.

1 of Lisbon's several magnificent viewpoints. Loved this one! It's an easy ride up from the Restauradores metro stop on the funicular (a little hard to find, but it's on a side street off of Av. da Liberdade), or a steep walk uphill from the Bairro Alto. We were in Lisbon during an unusually hot stretch in June (95 F every day), so the lovely park with lots of glorious shade and a fountain was a welcome sight. I particularly like this lookout spot because you can see the water, the Alfama, and the Baixa Chiado from here. Unfortunately the top of the Rossio train station is quite prominent and is hideous. But just look beyond that and pretend it's not there :)After taking in the view here, we walked down the Rua da Misericordia into the heart of the Bairro Alto. All in all, the trip up and then down made for a very pleasant afternoon.* If you like my review, I appreciate you clicking the 'helpful' button; those of us who take the time to write reviews live for those and it motivates us to do more :) *
One a the romantic Miradouro's. Here we came with our guide from The Lisbon Experience, we drunk a great limonade and overlooked the amazing city of Lisbon.A moment of joy and happiness.
Superb Views. Well worth a visit, even just to sit for half an hour and watch the view, easy to get to right at the top of the Gloria funicular.

Great view over the Baixa quarter. Great View over Lisbon (Baixa quarter).Its the second best belvedere after Sao Jorge's castle!! The view is even more attractive at sunset or by night when the castle is floodlit. Also at night the terrace becomes a popular outside meeting for young ppl, really close to night-out streets of Bairro Alto.
One of the best views. This is one of the best places to see lisbon. The view is amazing.This garden is perfect for a rest when visiting bairro alto or chiado área.

Beautiful vista of the city. Beautiful little plaza with fountain and open-air cafe, providing an almost panoramic view of the central neighborhoods of the city. I was just wandering around the city by myself on my first day in Lisbon and came across this place, and was very happy to sit for a while, take in the views, and do some people-watching. It's great that the city provides these vista points.

Great views day or night not to be missed. Great to enjoy views over the city, you can see the castle almost at the same level as the belvedere , great atmosphere with lights and a couple of quiosques servicing drinks. A must if you around Baird alto. Very good for any time of trip and specially for romantic stays.

fantastic place. It's wonderful part of Lisbon. We lived nearby and every day walked narrow streets, lidtening to Fado music (sometimes even couldn't sleep because of it:-). I liked Alfama the most in Lisbon, definetely worth to visit. But be ready to climb so no high heels :-)
Nice view. In Lisbon you will find several sites where you can have a look over the city. This one can be reached by a cable car.
Good views. The castle perched on the hilltop is a great place for views all over Lisbon. The castle and walks are well preserved and is very interesting to have a look around.

Very romantic garden. One of the best views of the city
Lots of benches are there to welcome to watch the city and beautiful castle of Sao Jorge

Beautiful place. It unravels a beautiful view of the city, including the Saint George Castle. It's not hard to get to (take a funicular if you feel a bit lazy or tired) and from it you can get to the Bairro Alto very easily.

It gives a nice view. You can walk up the city streets or take a funicular to the site,
The area provides an interrupted view looking from north to South, to the castle.
There are two levels and I really liked the lower level as it allowed a better view to the water.
A nice place to sit, especially in the evening

Cool area to chill. Rode the tram up and got a really nice view of the city. Really nice restaurants around as well. Great area to hang with friends. Very peaceful. Pigeons in the summer are annoying though..
one of my favorite views. The view is just amazing. You can enjoy the view on a bench or you can enjoy with a nice cold beer or a sangria. Go for it!!!!
Must see. One of the best views in town! And in a very trendy spot. A must go place to have an overview on the downtown city.

real experience. We rode the Gloria funicular up to the St. Peter viewpoint. We were there with the locals enjoying the cool temps and view of the tagus river. We had a sandwich and glass of wine at the little cafe. A delightful experience
One of the best photo spots in Lisbon. It's a very good place to visit, with a very nice view over all "old Lisbon" - The Castle, Rossio, Praça do Comércio, Alfama, etc.

Great spot to hang out by day and night. The view over Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara is exceptional. You will feel like you are watching Lisbon from top of the world. This viewpoint is great place to meet up and hang out with your friends. There are many benches around. You can also bring your own drink and enjoy the jaw-dropping view with your fellows during the night time. This place is also next to Bairro Alto, you can simply walk to any restaurants or bars and let your night flow. Do not miss this spot!!!
Unique view.. ...the all of Lisbon at your feet. Great views and a great experience. Just forgot my camera. A shame to miss that incredible light at the time.

Great view of the city's center. This is a great place to rest a little bit, between city walks... in different parts of the day you can get different lights and different results with your photography experiences... here you can take a drink and eat something simple... seeing great background!!!!

Beautiful view of Lisbon. This is a place for a nice break during a busy traveling day. The view of Lisbon - castle and downtown - is amazing, and there's a beautiful tile panel that explains what we are looking at. And, to top it all of, you are just around the corner from several delicious restaurants, and next to a cable car that takes you to Lisbon's downtown. Particularly spacial at the end of the day/sunset.
Great views and food nearby. Nice place to just chii out, enjoy the views, have some food from the nearby restaurants and open a bottle of wine.
one of the top 10 spots in Lisbon. one of the top 10 spots in Lisbon! there are several miradouros in Lisbon one should visit, this is one of them giving a great view over the castle.

A lovely view and the perfect place for a drink and a quiet stroll in the city.. One of the best views in Lisbon and a great place to share a drink and a walk with friends on a summer's evening. It's easily accessible from Bairro Alto or Chiado and you can walk down the tram tracks to Restauradores too, though the climb up is very steep.

Elevated civic space close to a cluster of visitor attractions. Miradoura Sao Pedro de Alcantara is worth visiting on its own with its kiosk, postcard views east and south, the occasional musicians and other artists. For me it was also the first of a collection of many elevated viewpoints, and photo opportunities, including the Miradoura's, hotel rooftop terraces, and the tops of civic monuments. For Miradoura Sao Pedro de Alcantara there is also the proximity of Elevador Graca, Egreja Sao Roque, Bairro Alto, and for me, Cervejaria Trindade on Rua Trindade.Garry

So cool at night. My boyfriend and I came here on a Friday night on the way to Bairro Altto and ended up getting out of the taxi early as we were intrigued by the big crowd around the sound of live music. What we discovered was a small band playing near the outdoor kiosk looking bar and people dancing with their shoes off. An absolutely awesome atmosphere accompanied by a beautiful view. Will definitely recommend anyone who wants to see the party scene of Lisbon to come here on their way to Bairro Altto!
Lisbon's Best View. Right on top of the Elevador da Gloria, this is a great spot to see Lisbon from above. We went at sunset and it was absolutely beautiful.

wow .. At the upper end of the miradouro there's a Kiosk , and after looking at the beautiful city below and the S. George Castle infront of you , you can relax for a few minutes in an armchair under the trees , with an ice cold Sagres beer in your hand and happiness in your heart , before you continue up to explore the Bairro Alto neighbourhood .
One of the best view over the city. Perfect spot to chill while exploring the city. Great views, especially as the sun starts going down.

Nice view of city. We didn't seek this area out but actually stumbled upon it. We only took a tram once on our seven day visit, so we climbed every hill there. This was one of them and I was delighted to sit and rest and enjoy the view. A sweet little park sits just below where people were walking their dogs. It was not crowded when we were there.

Speechless!. This place offers breathtaking views of Lisbon. Very lively square, always a lot of people. They also have a couple of nice cafes there and the staff speak very good english. A beer, great weather and fascinating views of the city: what else could you ask for?

Relaxing spot, lovely view. We came across this miradouro by accident, whilst having a wander around the Bairro Alto. It is nice area to have a sit down and relax and admire the views.The views are not as impressive as other areas of Lisbon but it is very relaxing area and worth a visit if you are in the area.It is not, however, somewhere I would specifically seek out, but it was a nice surprise when we were out exploring the city.
Another wonderfull seightseeing in Lisbon. This place is special not only because of it´s view, but it´s near to Bairro Alto, an amazing place to have a night out with friends.

Delightful!. What a view! It was the first miradouro we visited, so a sentimental favorite as we got our first panoramic look. It's well positioned-- easy walks to other places you want to explore. The people watching with an adult beverage is a wonderful way to spend Lisbon time.
Not one of the best viewpoint in Lisbon. Not one of the best viewpoint in Lisbon but is a nice place to site a little and rest, is quiet and fresh in a very sunny day.
Castle View. One of the best sightseeing on Lisbon Castle with the possibility to have a dring of snack something from one of the quiosques (small typical bars)

Stop on self-guided walking tour. Decided to do a self-guided walking tour and this was one of the stops. With a great navigator and following the map, was able to locate this stunning outlook quite easily. Gorgeous views over the city and nice spot to sit and relax after the tram ride up the hill. Worth taking in to enjoy the views of the city in a park like setting.

Great view at night!. Come here near sunset to enjoy the beautiful views of Lisbon below. While not as breathtaking as Miradouro das Portas dol Sol or Miradouro da Senhora do Monte in Alfama, it provides an amazing panoramic of the city, especially at nightfall when you look westward towards the illuminated Castelo do Sao Jorge. There's also a charming little garden situated here for you to enjoy while taking a stroll through this part of town, which is up on a hill and lined with countless restaurants to appease your appetite after soaking in the gorgeous sights.

Wonderful on a Breezy Summer Morning. We rode the Elevador da Gloria up on a Sunday morning and really enjoyed the view and how nice the tree-lined park is. The Elevador does not begin running until ten AM, at least onSundays, I'm not sure otherwise, so keep that in mind.
wonderful area. grandios view, botanic garden, easy to walk, easy to find, free entrance, view to the Castelo Sao Jorge, possibility to rest, a small coffee/cola/refresh kiosk, toilettes

Nice, but not a must. There are so many viewpoints in Lisbon that it is hard to see why this one should be a particular point of call. Pleasant enough, if you are in that part of town, but no need to make a special trip to get there.
Enjoy the view. Great views of the city, not as crowded or busy as other "miradouros" around town. Plus its location is very favorable.
Beautiful City Views. The views of the city from this miradouro are absolutely beautiful, and there is even a little garden/park area where you can have a seat and admire the beautiful city..

Beautiful oasis in Lisbon by Barro Alto. With lovely gardens, gorgeous views, a café for refreshments, benches and cooling breezes, its a great place to relax and people watch, you can also buy a sandwich nearby and eat it there.
Very good vews of the city. From this place, we can see an important part of Lisbon, and even the castle. And you are very near the "drinks quarter" of Lisbon.

Lovely view of the town. Lisbon is a city of hills & dales. This is a little square on top of a hill offering a balcony over the city. In fact, there are two sides. A shaded square with fountains and benches to sit and a few steps below another open garden with another balcony. This is one of the best view you can get of the city and the castle standing on another hill in front. It is also a place to rest for a while cooling off in the shade while admiring the view or taking the time to read. There are two side cafés to refresh as well on each terrace. The incline (or funicular) is nearby. So a good way to get there is to go up with this typical means of transport and then decide to walk the street stairs downhill.

My favorite Miradouro in Lisbon.. Located right near the heart of the city, this miradouro is very easily accessible. It's right next to the Gloria Elevator tram from Restauradores Square.The views across the city to the castle are stunning. It is big and the gardens are very refreshing. Don't miss the lower terrace, with it's quieter seats.
The best view of the Castle. This and the Castle combined will give you a total view of Lisbon. The overlook is terraced, with benches and shady spots to enjoy. It's well worth the walk up.

Delightful terrace and great views. We' d seen this mirador from São Jorge so wanted to find it and I'm glad we made the effort. It is a lovely park area, peaceful and a terrific perspective of Lisbon.
Amazing view. Look at the amazing view, people watch and drink some wine on the terrace. Great way to chill out in LIsbon

Just wonderful !. After visiting the Igreja de S. Roque(S. Roque church) at the Largo da Misericórdia, go staight ahead and you will fand a small but wonderful garden that gives you a bird´s eye view of Lisbon...i love it!
What a view!. Best place to see Lisbon at night. For those of you that came to Lisbon for the first time, I sugest a tuk-tuk tour to see old Lisbon.
Above the city!. Rode the funicular up the hill and enjoyed the views...especially of the Castle since we had been there the day before. A nice garden area on the lower level of the viewing spot.
Great view. This is a good place for walk. Great view, especially of the Castelo Sao Jorge. There are a lot of benches so you can sit and take a rest in a hot day.

Great view of the city, especially of the Castelo Sao Jorge, which is on the opposite hill.. It is situated in Bairro Alto. From there, we had a great view of the city, especially of the Castelo Sao Jorge, which is on the opposite hill.
Really amazing view of Lisbon downtown. One of my favourite spots in Lisbon. Beautiful view of downtown Lisbon and great spot for a well deserved rest after walking up and down hill all day.
A Peaceful Square. The Miradouro is on two levels. We spent a happy 20 minutes on the upper level enjoying the views and the lovely fountains.
Not worthwhile. I don't really understand why it should be a nice place to visit: it faces the wrong side of the city, the old and ugly one.
Great. Wonderful view, romantic, safe and quiet. Recommend to spend a lovely late afternoon. We will return

Nice view of the city of Lisbon. Went up to the park just after sunset. Took the Gloria lift to the park and had nice views. Not sure which spot has the best views of Lisbon, but this would be one of them.

Nice view. A good place to view the city from above. Also a good place to start going through Bairro Alto. You can take the funicular up the hill from Praça dos Restauradores. A lot of drug pushers near the funicular, though.

Great for sunrise over Lisbon. Good for coffee at outdoor tables in a 19th century park overlooking downtown Lisbon. But you may not want to be there for the free-form drinking party every night into the dawn.
Among the best views in Lisbon. Every visitor to Lisbon must come here and have a drink at the outdoor cafe which provides the best views of this beautiful city.

Nice view. It's a viewpoint, so of course you get a pretty good overview of the city. What makes this one so nice is the whole atmosphere around it. With 2 little kiosks, lots of people, some vendors and the Elevador da Gloria and Bairro Alto nearby, it's a must-see in Lisbon.

Maybe a nice place to start a Lisbon tour. This is a nice spot for a sightseeing of grand part of the city.
If it's your first time in the city, it worth starting here, checking city's "hotspots" at the labeled map.
The location is great, right next to Chiado / Bairro Alto and there's a coffee kiosk with tables that is great to chill out in summer.

Nice view, obviously, since it's a viewpoint :-). Nice terrace with a kiosk where they serve drinks, sandwiches and some pasta. Lots of pigeons as well. The staff at the kiosk is nice. And of course you get a very nice view over Lisbon. Nice and quiet location.

Beautiful view, lovely little cafes. Always a good place to stop and breath in Lisboa, be it day, night or early hours of the morning. It can get busy but its brilliant for a quick-stop. In the summer there is live music, always wonderful!

good but far from being the best. This is one of the many miradouros in Lisbon, it really offers a cool view of the city and the Castle, but if you wish to have better views from the City just to take some awesome panoramics or just hang around with friends, you'll find more interesting options like the one in front of Igreja da Graça;
Great scenic view over Lisbon. Very good place to see old Lisbon and the castle. Near Bairro Alto, with his pubs, restaurants and night life.

Beautiful vista, clean spacious park. Beautiful vista overlooking the city.
Many benches and a couple of cafes in the park for drinks, snacks etc.
Relaxing view. This Miradouro has a relaxing vibe to it and we enjoyed our short stay there. The views are not exceptional, however, they are good and definitely worth a visit if you are in the area.
not possible loose this Miradouro. one of the best gardens to see old Lisbon. Stay there the time you can, because all time you will discover one more interesting thing to see

Good view close to city centre. This is the closest to downtown of the lookout points in Lisbon. It is the most accessible by walking or taking the funicular. It’s definitely worth to stop up. It’s not very big so 30 minutes to just walk around and take some snaps is perfect.
Viewpoint!. Nice view to St. George's and Rossio. Be sure to take the escalator uphill. The were shooting Spanish "Master Chef" when we were there, fun to watch at.
A hidden gem. We stumbled upon this viewpoint by accident, and it was the great way to end our trip to Lisbon. From here you can get some of the best photos of Lisbon and enjoy a cold beer!
Nice view . Just a nice view, not breathtaking. But if you catch the gloria funicular, its right beside the top so walk across for a brief visit

Amazing view!. This is one of my favorite places in Lisbon. I love to stay here after a working day and enjoy the landscape at the sunset. After that, I love to go to eat in the restaurants of the Barrio Alto. Do not miss it!

Nice park, good view. I was expecting a breathtaking view and found an average one. Lisboa do not have a amazing city view. The park terraces were nice and the seagulls welcoming you were very cute. I took the tram from Avenida Liberdade for the steep hill to Alcantara, which cost 3 Euro for up & down. I spent only 15 minutes there and took the same tram down. The walls on the way of the tram were painted with a lot of Graffitis, which was very nice. It was nice to see the old town from the top, however it was not breathtaking.

At the other side from Senhora do Monte. This Miradouro is at the top of the old Bairro Alto area, in the western part of the city. Therefore I suggest going there around dusk, by the sunset, when the opposite hill with Sao Jorge castle and the whole central area is sunbathed. You can get real perfect photos from here.Being there at dusk, you can proceed then to the restaurant area of Bairro alto for dinner at nice (but pricey) at one of many rastaurants there.The best way to reach the Miradouro is by the steep hill tram (funicular) which starts from the Restaudores square.Beware, the ticket is 3,60 EUR for less than 5 minute ride.

Lovely view. Other than the view from St. George's castle, this would be my favorite view of Lisboa. There is a small "garden" at the site, that is great for taking pictures and taking in this beautiful city.

Some of the best views. This is a lovely spot that you shouldn't miss while in Lisbon. It's calm and perfect for photos during the day. All sorts of people gather there, locals and tourists alike for a short break and very nice views over Lisbon.

Great view by night, but best by day. From here you can see the Lisbon castle, the area called "Costa do Castelo" (trans.: Castle Coast), Martim Moniz area, Mouraria neighborhood and Alfama neighborhood, which is really beautiful by night.Be aware that this sightseeing spot is near Bairro Alto, so expect lots of (sometimes drunk) people at night, at every day of the week, but specially at weekends. If you want to enjoy this view from a more calm place, there are others in this area for you.Because of this, I recommend you to visit this place by day, where there is much less noise and disturbance.
nice view. just right after the stop of the elevador da gloria comes this lovely place, with a very nice view of the city, you can relax under the trees, take an imperial at the kiosk... chilling
Amazing views. Amazing views over Lisbon, overlooking the castle, the sea, and Avenida Liberdade. If you are going from the Avenida, you can take the tram uphill to get here.

Nice View. We had about an hour to kill before our dinner reservation at a restaurant close by this place so we ended up hanging out here for a bit listening to live music and enjoying the view of the sunset. It's a nice place to see if you're in the area but I wouldn't come all the way up here just for the view. There are other places in Lisbon, like the castle, that offer a view of the city.

Check out the view!. This is a wonderful spot to take a sweeping look at Lisbon from.
You can spot numerous landmarks in Eastern Lisbon from this belvedere – the main one being São Jorge castle.
Just in case you need some assistance with the landmarks, there's a beautiful tiled map of the view to help you out.

Lovely viewpoint. We came across this viewpoint by accident and thought the view lovely especially as the other viewing points are on the other side. It had just been raining and so there were some great cloud formations. At the time of writing this (end of October) the funicular Gloria is not working.
One of the best views in Lisbon!. Have a delicious glass of sangria de espumante (with cucumber) and enjoy one of the most fantastic views in Lisbon!

Nice view. Arriving there from Elevador de Gloria or from Bairro Alto you are in front of a great view of Lisbon accompanied by nice gardens.
One of the many miradouro, sightseeing places of Lisbon which is worth visiting.
Beautiful!. The best miradouro in Lisbon. Not as busy as the others seemed to be and had a lovely park and fountain.

Excellent View, Beautiful Gardens & near on the Funicular - don't miss this place!. The view is worth the walk up and you can explore the lovely streets as you go.
Tips: Take a coffee break on the way down and enjoy some of the delicious Portuguese pastries and cakes. You can take the tram and then the funicular up to the lookout if you prefer & do the reverse on the way down.

What a gorgeous place. Went there for a second time, it is certainly the best view over Lisbon at night. The tiny chapel (Senhora do Monte) is very beautiful as well as the Lady's statue. The S. Jorge castle looks more charming when observed from this Miradouro than from anyplace else in Lisbon

Beautiful park with a fantastic view and cold beer. While the park is a magnet for young people, especially during the evening-- it is for everyone. A magnificent viewpoint overlooking the central city and beyond to the hills of Alfama and the castle. Don't miss the view in the evening, or at sunset, or at any time. The cafe is also a treat, especially after walking on a hot day!

Relax and take in the View. Nice walk up from the city brings you to this garden/park area with a little coffee shop where you stop chill and catch your breath.Great views of the Castle and east of the city also very tranquil to recharge your batteries.Also gives a relief break from the sun and heat.Worth a visit.

Great view. In the evening this viewpoint is the meeting point for many young people. It is near "Erasmus Corner" and many bars. You have a really great view to Castelo de São Jorge and the rest of the city. If you have a daily or monthly pass for public transportation, you may use the tram ("Elevador da Glória") without paying anything.

Best landscape in Lisbon. Really beautiful place.
Probably the best view of Lisbon.
I advice to go there walking or in trolley (I prefer walking so I can take photos of the famous trolleys).
Arrive by underground tunnel. A door in the wall near the cafe is where you arrive if you take the underground tour of the Mae de Agua reservoir!

One of my favorite Miradouro's in Lisbon. My hostel was really near this nice Miradouro, I went here to drink a few beers in the afternoon sun. To make some notes of all the things I did do that day and to think about what I was going to do next. If you want to go up with the Elevador da Glória, go up and the miradouro is just around the corner. Really nice view of the castle on the hill as well, the Santa Justa elevator has a better view of that. But well.. you can't get a beer there ;)

A nice view, but after Santa Justa it was kind of a letdown. I expected this to be the most scenic view in the whole of Lisbon and it might have been, had I not previously seen the view from the top of the Santa Justa elevator. All in all, very nice but certainly not he best one out there.

Gorgeous view of Lisbon and its 7 hills. You can take the tram up the hill and enjoy the magnificent view. The hill where is located is called Bairro Alto and is famous by it night life and restaurants – bars.From there just walk down the street and have a visit to churches and Misericórdia Museum. It end in Chiado where you can have a coffee at the Portuguese typical café Brasileira.
Very nice view. Best place to have a drink at night or a coffee during the afternoon ! But the service isn't always very good. The view is amazing

Beautiful views. A must see during your visit to Lisbon, the views are pretty spectacular and you get a very good idea of the layout of Lisbon. There are also street music and some local artists. Or course, you can also fill up your water bottles!
Great view and orientation for Lisbon. Superb view over Lisbon from a calm shady belvedere. There are benches to relax on and kiosks to by beer and snacks. Perfect start to a tour of Lisbon.
Nice to see. A great place where you can see the all sight of Lisbon and the Tejo river and other sites like Alfama square

Lovely sight. This is a big "miradouro". Its placed near by what I would call the most interesting streets in Lisbon. The place is big, we had no problem staying here for several hours. By the way; the (white) Sangria at the bar there is fantastic.

Start your Lisbon trip from here.... The view of the city you get from here is great. There is a little park with cosy little cafe as well. This was my second favorite miradouro after Senhora do Monte. A great place to start your Lisbon city trip!

Nice place to view Lisbon. One of the non expensive and beautiful place to sit and relax. Spend an evening enjoying the breeze, Fado songs by a man and fabulous view of Lisbon. Take the Tram 28 and get down here. For people who like photography can enjoy the views and can spend whole evening here. I visited this place mainly based on listing on trip advisor.

Listen the fado....... One of the most beautiful viewing point of Lisboa, closed to the upper stop of elevador Gloria.Big park, pleasant air, good place to relax. A man was singing very good fado songs with a guitar hourslong in portuguese and french. He has a very good voice. It was really good to be there, listen the songs, and watching the beautiful city.
View of Lisbon. Great place to sit and people watch and have a fabulous view of Lisbon. Relaxing. Nice little cafe for good and reasonable refreshments.
exelent. its a very nice place to stop and have a wonderful view of old Lisbon.its not a good place to go late at night
Good spot!!. Great spot to sit and have a early drink before dinner and watch the city lights coming on, with Saint George's Castle on the background! A must go...
Plenty to see and visit in Belem. From Tore to Monastery, to cream cakes and restaurants, carriage museum, maritime museum, parks... You can spend more than just a great day in Belem.

One of the many wonderful views of Lisbon. Astonishing view in one of the more typical areas of old Lisbon.A wonderful choice to have a drink and relax early morning catching the rising sun or at the end of the day.Pay atention to a tunnel recently open that connects underground, this Miradouro with a marvelous garden in the surroundings

An excellent view over Lisbon.. Get an excelent view over Lisbon, the beautiful city awaits your visit. You'll overlook the castle of St.George in front of you and the Avenue of Liberdade (Liberty) and downtown Lisbon (a Baixa). This is a nice spot to rest after strolling through the narrow streets of Bairro Alto.

A beautiful sightseeing spot. Lisbon has in São Pedro de Alcantara one of its most beautiful sightseeing. You can see the river, Terreiro do Paço, the castle and all the downtown. It's a lovely place to walk, very near Chiado, Bairro Alto, Príncipe Real and Avenida da Liberdade.

Great view. Awesome view, great city. We will come back for sure.
We will never Forget those days.
Also, nice bear!

Great view and rest. One of the best views in Lisbon (and there are many, many of them). Excellent resting place in all periods of day, especially during hot afternoons and evenings, when you can have a drink in the bar and enjoy in the shadows of high trees. If you don't feel like walking uphill, hop on the Elevador da Bica - an interesting and unusual driving experience and you're up in 2 minutes!
A view to never forget. This is really a place for you to go when visiting Lisbon. The view from here is amazing during the day or at night. If you have a chance, try both (I did it).

Fun & free way to see the city. Impressive view of Lisbon, we took in the sights while enjoying a beer. The walk up was steep, but manageable and gave a good feel of the city with so many shops and restaurants along the way.

One of the best places for taking in Lisboa.. Set on the edge of Bairro Alto this is a spacious bellevue with an atmosphere of its own. If you do not fancy the climb, an elevador will take you there effortless and in the typical style of the city. The view is stupendous ranging from the top of The Parque Eduardo vii, the Castelo Sao Jorge is just opposite and the twin towers of the Sé stand out in relief to the background of the estuary of the Tejo, and below linger the Rossio and Baixa ... Not to be missed.
As good as Santa Justa. The view from this Miradouro is just as good as from the viewing platform of the Santa Justa elevator, and it's free.

Lovely views of the Castle and the City. From this Miradouro you can enjoy a great view over the City towards St Georges Castle. The best views are in the evening as the sun illuminates the view. In the morning the sun is in the wrong direction and everything is in shadow giving poor results to photographs. Well worth a visit after an enjoyable dinner. There is a snack bar which we did not use so cannot comment.on.
great spot. Great spot to view the downtown specially at night for drinks if you don't want to hangout at Bairro Alto
Day or Night. Beautiful view of the Castelo de São Jorge, Baixa, Rio Tejo, Avenida da Liberdade from Bairro Alto. Renovated garden on lower level return a wonderful spot to full glory day or night.

splendid views of Lisbon city and the castle. We stayed in Atlantico hotel just below this gardens, we walked here every evening to see the sunset and beautiful Lisbon. simply superb.If you have some time then you can easily spend and hour or so watching the view or simply seating in the beautiful landscaped gardens
best view. If some one , want to see lisbon, this is a good spot to goo and to take same pictures ! and you can stay ther relaxing antil you drink a coffe on quiosque

Great Miradouro. This view point of the city is one of the best. It's large with a formal garden on two levels. It's located in one of the best touristparts of the city, Barrio Alto with plenty shops and restaurants, large and small. In the opposite direction is the Principe Real Park. Transportation is not a problem, trolleys and taxis are plentiful. You can even get to the Rossio(downtown) by taking the Santa Gloria elevator which is next to the miradouro.

great view - too many bums. I have been in Lisbon before and really love the city. I was amazed at the number of mendicants, beggars and bums this time around. Not sure if that's about the economic crisis or time of year but I did not like it as much. The view from the miradour is excellent if you want to gain some perspective of the city and see the castle from the other side but you may not appreciate being approached by guys offering hashish, cocaine and pot - I wasn't.

Lovely for evening drinks. We stayed a short walk from this miradouro and it was perfect to stroll up to in the evening sun, buy a drink and sit enjoying the views. But beware, can be very breezy as you are so high up! Brilliant view of the Castle.
Best view of Lisbon. For me this is the best view of Lisbon.At night people gather to talk and have some wine.If you are felling tired to climb all the way up there, just take Elevador da Glória!

Handy viewpoint, near good Fado.. If you use the elevador da Gloria from Restauradores to get up the extremely steep hill, then this very good viewpoint is only a few yards to the right. It's also only a short walk back from here to the Fado in Chiado (left/downhill from the elevador).

A good photo op from the Barrio Alto. Go in the afternoon or evenig for the best light, since you will be facing east. Just to the right from the top of the Elevador (funicular) da Gloria, which starts near Restauradores metro station. Buy a transit day pass -- the single fare is too expensive to be worth the funicular rides.

good spot for pictures, a brake or a preview. one of several "miradouros° with beautiful views iver Lisbon city.Near barrio alto and a couple of blocks above Liberdade Avenue is a good spot for sunset as a preview to dine in the "barrio"

Amazing viewpoint in Lisbon!. An outstanding view over the downtown, located in the cultural, arts and nightlife district.from here you may also admire the castle hill - amazing, specially by sunset time, when the light is facing on the castle hill!
Our favourite spot. This terrace/garden is really beautiful,view is amazing,there is a little cafe with some sun loungers and a few tables so You can have a coffee or a cocktail and just chill :)
Nice view !. Perfect during the day to take some nice shot from the city or at night to have a beer with friends !

Beautiful views, awful place to park.... The miradouro itself was a very nice experience, we were there early evening on a Friday. I have driven from Alvor, Algarve all the way to Lisbon and we were exploring the city. This was our last stop before driving back to Algarve again. It was quite daunting to find a parking space nearby but I finally managed to park on a very hilly side street. The place itself was very romantic and we could rest after the stressful parking incident and trying to cope with the weekend traffic in Lisbon which was quite annoying not because it's busy which it isn't that bad but the people in Lisbon make it awful with their behaviour whilst behind the wheel. Apart from the evening breath taking views there's also a small café with a nice pastel de nata and a tasty espresso café. I also had a caipirinha but it wasn't that tasty! Looking @ Lisbon listening to Brazilian Bossa Nova. They also provide blankets at this café for people that feel a bit chilly :) Recommended to couples that need a romantic time out, Lisbon is quite sexy but get a cab :)

Spectacular view in sunset. This venue has an spectacular view of the city center and São Jorge castle. You can have drinks and food around so you may sit down and contemplate the colors of the beautiful Lisbon sunset.

One of Lisbon's best views!. I pass this Miradouro almost every day on my way from work and always love it. The city view is just beautifull and the surronding space too. You can spend some time on the garden or have a drink at the quiosque. Dont miss this spot when visiting Lisbon!

Stunning view, OK food.. Located in the Bairro Alto, the main reason for eating here is the view over the city and down to the river. A tiled map against the railings identifies the main features of the landscape. Service was quick when we ate at luchtime, despite the fact that only one waiter appeared to be covering all the tables. Sandwiches, beer and a glass of rose went down well and was not expensive. Location is just to the right of the top of the Elevador de Gloria - the funicular railway disguised as a tram. This runs from the NW corner of the Praca dos Restauradores.
One the most spectacular views of Lisbon. If you like landscapes, this is the one from Lisbon. You can have a drink and sit around listening to people playing music.

One of Lisbon's great panoramas. You can spend a good deal of time during your visit to Lisbon getting to their miradouros, their panoramas which are frequently little parks or squares with cafes and incredible views of the city. My advice is, if you only have time or inclination to visit one, make it this one. You can reach it from the downtown by walking north to Avenida de Liberdade, crossing to the left side of the street, and taking the funicular Elevador/Ascensor da Gloria. At the top, just turn right, and presto, there is the amazing view!
Perfect. Here you can sit down, ear some music and enjoy the excellent view! Came here and love lisbon! They also have some bar to drink amazing drink! i truly recommend!
stunning view. a great place to view lisbon. very pleasant and popular with locals. lovely place to start the evening.

The prettiest view. Loved this Miradouro, and came back another time en route to the Palace. If you get a table near the railings, it's a lovely view , even under the hot sun. A coffee and a croissant was delightful. The city splays out one side and the sea on the other. Hugely picturesque, and worth the ride! Like a giant embroidery. Many photo opps, lots of ourists but a happy place. I was traveling alone but at least two people offered to take my pic with the view! Somewhere the essence of Lisbon here...

Just near Bairro Alto, don't miss the view overlooking the castle. This belvedere/viewpoint is probably one of the best. From here, you can have a great view over the Lisbon Castle and the city.
Very central, near Bairro Alto and Chiado, you should not miss it, it's just next to Sao Roque Church.
There is also a tram/funicular just next to the Miradouro, that takes you to downtown (Av Liberdade/Restauradores)

Very nice. Nice view over the castle hill. Due to its big dimensions, the environment is not the best as people are quite dispersed and sometimes it is the meeting point for a not so good frequence...

Great view. A well created space with a view over the streets of Lisbon. Plenty of seating, greenery and refreshments. Artists also painting and selling their wares at not extorniate prices. Go up on Elevador Gloria from Restauradores.

A wonderful place in Bairro Alto. Sunny outlooks all round with a kiosk for drinks, seats around plus a lower tier with garden area to lounge about. Fantastic views.
Take the Gloria train, turn right & enjoy.

Not the best miradouro in Lisbon but worth the walk/funicular. I like the view better from the miradouros just below the Castelo near the Museu de Artes Decoratives and Santa Luzia church but Sao Pedro de Alcantara is right by the top of the Gloria funicular or on your way up rue Sao P de A from Praca Luis Camoes, so definitely worth a stop.
Great views. This view point offers great views on the city and specially on castello de San Jorge , but miradouro de senhora do monte is higher and has better views in my opinion

Beautiful View. This is a great place to take in great views of Lisbon. It is a rather large park area overlooking the city. We stayed right up the hill and enjoyed stopping here pretty much every day of our visit. If you go on a Saturday night be prepared for a lively drinking crowd.

A bird's view. Take the tram "Elevador da Gloria", from Restauradores place" up to Jardim Principe Real. or just walk up the hill - Chiado, Bairro Alto (a very IN place at night). From the Mirdouro you will have a beautiful view over the historical centre of Lisbon. In front of you, the S.Jorge Castle!
Always a pleasure!. I have gone there many times in my life, having grown up in Lisbon. I urge all travelers to stop by, enjoy the view, have a drink and just soak up the atmosphere

Go to Miradouro da Senhora do Monte. Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara is a nice visit combined with the church Igreja de Sao Roque, and maybe the view is better at night. But if you have less time, or are not interested in seeing the church, I would suggest Miradouro da Senhora do Monte instead. This viewpoint is much higher, and you can see much more of Liboa and of the water, and it's only 5 minutes walk off of Tram 28.

Great Views. Take the train elevator to get here and enjoy the splendid views from the Mradouro. There are a few restaurants nearby, easy to get some ice cream or smth to dring. It's a popular meeting place so sometimes it gets crowdy.
Great views of Lisbon. One of those great miradouros in Lisbon. Great for people-watching as well. Best reached walking downhill--we came from Rato Metro station.

A great view. This place during the morning can be very peaceful and it has a great view to the whole city of Lisbon.
At night it's a place where groups of friends reunite and get together for a night well spent and partying in their own way.

Great view.... ...and that's not just of the 12 foot street art phallus directly in front of you! Great spot for a relaxing wee dougie of sagres, with panoramic vistas of the castle, the lake and orange tiled rolling roofs of the city centre. Can get busy quickly when the sun comes out. Freshly squeezed orange juice is some of the best I've tasted.
Drop dead gorgeous!. Amazing view. Start your trip to Lisbon here. With a wee cerveza. In my opinion this is good as it gets.
Great view. Lovely little park with a cafe, very relaxing just to sit and take in the fantastic view over the city to the river and castle. Right next to the Barrio Alto with loads of eating places.

Great views of city and castle. We kinda stumbled across this park after visiting Igreja de Sao Roque - while there are great views that is really all this park to offer. There are some street artists and plenty of visitors... Anyone with an interest in photography would definately enjoy a visit here. Didnt get to visit at night but I would think night views would be pretty spectacular
Miradoura Sao Pedro. a spectacular view of the city. Lovely to sit drinking a coffee and enjoying the beauty. It has good restaurants and coffee around. The view is really worth and worth the visit.

Great view of the city.. You can see the whole downtown from that place, and take a rest before keep walking, you can take the tram from the Praça dos Restauradores to the top of the hill very close to the miradouro.

You can't miss this one!. You'll have Lisbon literally at your feet, the views are excellent... it reaches out to the Tagus River and the Sao Jorge castle.Come and wait for the sun set and then head out to Bairro Alto, just behind, to treat yourself to an amazing dinner!

Great views. Very cold day at end of February so not at its most glamorous. However, we were warm from our exertions walking up from.the river side. simples really, Walk up hill - "Are we there yet?" Look around, enjoy fascinating buildings,people, etc, "No" - walk up more hill - repeat until breathless and then - surprise! Smashing.Better still, then finally discover where the Gloria lift is! Ha!

Romantic scene!. One of the most, if not the most, romantic place to watch the full moon rise behind the Castelo Sao Jorge, if you are lucky enough to be there during full moon. Among the "miradouros"of the city this is my favourite one and for some reason it is never crowded as the other ones in Alfama. It has a cafe and it is a few paces away from the restaurant area of bairro Alto.

must go. It's near the city center and you will probably be in the area, so there's no reason not to go! We thought it was easy to find. It's a great place to take some pictures and spend a few minutes looking out over the city.
superb panorama. superb panorama also at night, also small terrace to enjoy the view with a drink as we did at night. nice view on the castello and much more

nice views. I really like this place and is a must see for visitors. Near to Bairro Alto, great location, has a little bar for snacks and beer, outdoor seating, good price and great view to the city. Perfect for summer days

Amazing views over central Lisboa. Not my favourite (No1 for me is Igreja de Graca miradouro) but very nice small park. Very easy to get there via Elevador da Gloria or via Satna Justa lift and than cca 10 mins walk.

beautiful views. a must visit place..just get something to drink at the coffee shop and u can just enjoy the view..i went during the day and the view was beautiful..check out the car being used as a planter box at the terrace..there is also an area at the terrace where people write their wishes on plastic sheets and pin in to the ropes from trees..

Nice view point and Sangria.. We took a half liter of Sangria for 7.50 euros at the little terrasse. It was nice and refreshing.The guitar player on the view point was playing some brazilian tunes... nice :)

beautifull all time. I was hosted next to this view point, and pass by a lot of times, not only pass by i spend a lot of time there, it looks difrente in the morning, evening and night, with difrente colores and lights, i could spend the hole day there
amazing view. Amazing view of Lisbon for free! It has some benches so you can sit and admire this great city and a little bar for a drink or a snack
Any mirador is fun. Go and enjoy the view, it doesn't matter which one it is, incorporate them into your getting around in the city

Our favorite Place. Wow what an amazing view !!! what a place if you sit on the bench for 20 mins and get yourself a drink from the cafe you can take in all what is in front of you, from here you can see the whole of lisbon, my wife brought me here for my 40th and it's a place i cannot get out of my head and i always think of when we talk about Lisbon , right opposite you can see the walls of the castle and the big window of the SE Cathedral and to the right is the river. My wife calls it our place it truely is an amazing view and you should not miss it

My favorite Place !. Gosh !! ,How I miss this ,From here you see all of Lisbon , I would suggest to go there at sunset and stay there till night strikes in . One of the most beautiful scenes you will probably enjoy , with the sun then the lights coming in and just capturing it silently makes it more amazing .enjoy sitting there with a cup of cafe' au lait and listen to the music playing in the background .Superb !

Wonderful view. Must stop in Lisbon. I suggest to go up to this point through Glória Elevator. then at your right side you can find this beautiful place with a brilliant landscape. From here, it is possible to see St Georges castle, Cathedral Sé and the river. During the summer is very comfortable to have a seat, drink something and appreciate all of this.
great pictures at this site. the view!!!!!!!great pictures at this site and the place is beautiful with a fountain...go see it. try sunset, its the best time!

Relaxing place with great view. Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara is one of the "must see" places in Lisbon. It is just few meters away from Bairro Alto, and if you do not like to walk on "hill", there is also funicular from Restauradores, which will bring you there. It is very relaxing place, where you can enjoy your meal, drink or just in magnificent view.
Great view. One of the many in Lisbon that you should go. There is a small bar where you can have somthing to eat or drink! Nice place for pics or just reading a book!

amazing view. this place as an amazing view through Lisbon Castle - Castelo de Sao Jorge - and the river also... You can sit in one of the chairs available there and just relax the view and the light of lisbon...

Great view over Lisbon. One of the best views of Lisbon. In front we see the Castelo de São Jorge and Miradouro da Senhora do Monte. To the south we could see the river Tejo. To the north we could see the Avenida da Liberdade with his stroll under the trees. Behind we have the magnificent neighborhood Bairro Alto. We can sit down in one of the park benches in this viewpoint and appreciate these magnificent views. A place not to miss.

What a view!. Amazing view from this park - big park, no jostling for views, and the view is fantastic! Lots of benches, small concession area, beautiful fountain, great place to sit, relax and take in the beauty! This park is right next to Gloria Elevator, and is on the border of Bairro Alto and Principe Real.

great view over lisbon. if you want to see lisbon and its roof tops and its castle this is the place to go!!! and now they have two nice coffee places to have a drink and snack while enjoying the view.
Steep Walk, Nice View. Beautiful view, especially at sunset. Long walk, but worth it. Can see the castle and the river. Made for a worthy destination.
Very beautiful views. Lisbon is all about the views, and you get a really good one from this Miradouro. Like for other Miradouros, make it a quick stopping point during a nice walk in the city.
One of the best views of Lisbon. Do not miss this spot were you will take beautiful photos of some of the 7 hills of Lisbon, where you can see the old Castle, the Cathedral and the river

My favourite Miradouro in the city. The view from the city you get at Miradouro Sao Pedro de Acantara became my favourite since the first time I've been there!Tou can see from Graca, the Castle, Alfama, all the way to the river Tagus. Downtown area, and behind you, Bairro Alto. So is great to check where you've been, plan where to go, take amazing pics, night or day. A must see. and for free :)
Great view over Lisbon. A bit windy but the view is worth it! There's a coffee shop where you can have some snacks but I suggest picnic style as you have several benches and a small garden.

Favorite afternoon place. We used to spend some time in the afternoon there, for relaxing and enjoying the nice view. The place is lively with a lot of young people and street artists. You can also have a drink in the outdoor cafe.

Great view of the city. We walked up the hill because our map wasn't clear where the funicular started but when we saw the crowd on the funicular we were happy to have done so. Great view, nice gardens, little kiosks with beverages and nearby streets of Barrio Alto to explore. The Porto bar was not open on Republic Day in midday.
great view. lovely spot, small gardens-fun to reach by funicular (and the Port wine Institute is across the street!)

Do not miss it! Beautiful view and it is free. Do not miss it! Beautiful view and it is free. You get one of the best views in the city and you dont have to pay like in the Castelo Sao Jorge, which is nice but there is no castle but just a nice view!
Best view over Downtown. Just chill and sit in a public bank and relax in front the view with St George Castle...better at Night...and having a Porto Wine nearby...

Possibly the best viewpoint in Lisbon!. Ditto. Offers a great view of the city. Very pleasant & large enough not to feel too crowded. Equally pleasant day & night! You can take the funicular up there though it is really not that much of a climb!

Some of the best views of Lisbon available. This is a great little gardenterrace with cafe, we stumbled upon it as there was no mention in our guidebook, we sat here for 2-3 hours drinking wine and taking in the fantastic views of Lisbon, castle and sea. There are two cafes available on the two levels and it's all just near the top of the funicular up from the avenue de liberado, make sure you add this to your list of afternoon lazing.
Wow what a View. in the same road as Igreja San Roche. Wonderful view across Lisbon to the Castle. There is a cafe where you could easily rest awhile and enjoy the views.

Unique spot for a cocktail. We sat at the cafe at the Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara each evening for an hour or two during our long weekend in Lisbon. It was a lovely romantic spot to have a couple of cocktails watching the sun go down on the castle and Alfama district. As the evening went on however the wind started to swirl around and it got absolutely freezing. The cafe had a supply of blankets to throw around the shoulders if it got too uncomfortable.During the day, the Miradouro is packet with tourists, entertainers and musicians, but there are still plenty of benches and sitting areas to while away and hour or so in the shade.
Wonderful Views. The Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara is a must see because of the marvelous views of the city from this spot.

Day or night.... This Miradouro not only gives you one of the finest views over central Lisbon, the Castle, and Tejo. Beautiful not at least at sunset... But are also always a place vibrant with life and with several outdoor-cafés. A place big enough to be more like a park, even in 2 levels: You can spend hours here...
Amazing view!. Amazing view to the castle & a part of Lisbon!Go to the lower part of the garden, have less people and have a drink in that small bar, very relaxing! :)
A great view. This Miradouro is located at Bairro Alto with a great view to the castle of São Jorge and Alfama.A visit at night is a must.

A window over Lisbon. A city lying over seven hills is always a city with charming belvederes and São Pedro de Alcantara is a good example of it. The space has been improved as it is now extended over two levels both with beautiful flowerbeds and small terraces
Nice view. Either before or after adventuring into Bairro Alto and /or Solar do Vinho do Porto, this privileged view is well deserved

Perfect spot for chilling out at sunset hour.. You'll be astonished by the vastness and amazing view.
This viewpoint has two levels, both with esplanades with live music, dj's, snaks and drinks.
Close to Bairro Alto and Gloria Funicular.

a sight for sore eyes. the midarouro is a great place to get your barings and a good place to sit and talk in the afternoon. The cafe is nice but has no toilet facilites. the outdoor cafe has a range of hot and cold snacks but the pigeons are a distraction and can cause a problem, if you don't like birds constantly at your feet. The views make up for this and you can get some panoranic photos of Avenida and across to the castle.

really nice view. Great place to hang, near Bairro Alto and Principe Real both really good places to eat and have some drinks in Lisboa.. At night you must be careful with your personal belongings, there are pickpockets around the area..

Magic sunset over Lisbon. It's a great spot to watch the sunset over Lisbon. It as a cafe (which in my opinion is overpriced), but you can always take your own drink or buy it in one of the groceries around and jus sit and lay back in one of the garden benches. It's a wonderfull way of ending a full-tour day and preparing to start the night in the nearby Bairro Alto.

Beautiful place to sit and enjoy a coffee and the view. This 'mirador' feels a little off the beaten track, but it's definitely worth seeking out. It's such a peaceful place, with amazing views of the river and further out to sea. Beautiful on a sunny day.

Picturesque pedestrian square with great views.. Very romantic in the evening too. The plaza is paved with traditional Lisbon black and white tiles, there are lovely plantings and trees, and plenty of benches to sit on and admire the gorgeous views of Placa Rossio and the Castelo St. Jorge.

Cool place to enjoy the views!. One of the best places to see a different view of Lisbon. It has a wonderful sight and an esplanade where you can drink a beer, either in the afternoon or by night.In the summer, the night gets really lively with many locals and visitors enjoying the music.A nice place for a drink after dining in Bairro Alto.

Beautiful sights by the day or by night.... The title of the review really says it all!Whether you go by day or by night this place has one the most unique views of the cit of Lisbon, combined with a beautiful park and even a well known food kiosk.Be sure not to miss to tile panel explaining all the different you can view from up here, be sure to identify them all!

at night!. Go to this place at night when it's dark and all the lights of the city are shining. You can climb from the Restauradores square but it's a pretty steep road. I recommend the 60-second ride by tram but if you do not have a daily transport card you will need to pay 2.75 Euro one-way. Enjoy!
best in the city. Best miradouro in the city. Full of annoying people trying to sell you necklaces. But great view point.

A Must!. If you come to Lisbon you can't miss this place! Right on the top of one of Lisbon's hill this view point gives you an amazing views of the castel and the cathedral. You can also have a drink in one of the bars... and relax....

Chill out spot. These gardens above the Rossio area offer a tranquil setting for some of the finest views over Lisbon. Very peaceful and there is a good little café in the corner. At the top end of the Gloria ‘elevator’ This side of town does not get too busy it seems and there is another fine small garden further on up the road towards the Jardim Botanico – I cannot remember the name, but is directly opposite the Jardim and there is a wonderful old cedar tree in the middle.
Amazing the view from this viewpoint. From this place we have a beautifull view of the others neighborhoods like the castle. Here you have a nice promenade with nice music.

amazing view. This is such a magical place. You feel like you have whole Lisbon in your hands and suddenly you feel this ease in you. Loved it. And there is no annoying people trying to sell you drugs.
My favourite viewpoint in Lisbon.. There are several view points in Lisbon, but this one, specially in summer nights, has a special magic. There's a kiosk with drinks, snacks and music.
amazing view of lisbon. the perfect place to see lisbon ,beautiful snaps for a great memory
Great view!. Great place to stom and enjoy the view whilst drinking a Nice cold beer to start your night off before going into bairro alto!

A must-see aspect of Lisbon life. I grew up with Blue Ridge Parkway overlooks, but Lisbon gets it right: these are like urban overlooks with seating for 50 and a wet bar. I happened upon my first one entirely by accident. This was my second, but it's arguably the best in Lisbon, with a marvelous view of the city and across to the castle on the next hill.
My favorite view in Lisbon!. You just have to go there to see for yourself. And don't forget to take Elevadore there or back, very cool

The Best View of Lisbon. This park is a magical spot. The views of Lisbon can't be beat, and there's an outstanding cafe where you can enjoy a nice lunch or afternoon coffee while watching the tourists and passers-by.Most of the lunch items at the cafe are simple, like toasted sandwiches, but they're tasty and not at all expensive. When the weather is nice, it's probably one of the best places to sit out and enjoy the day.

a great place to stop and enjoy the city. you can look across the city to the castel sao jorge and sip on a drink while soaking in local color. jsut up principe real is a jardim with lovely trees and quiet atmosphere despite being on a major thouroughfare. just down the hill is igreja sao roque (not to be missed) and barrio alto. take a moment to sit and enjoy this lovely spot in the middle of everything.

Great View over Lisbon!. Miradouro São Pedro de Alcantara is a beautiful space. With a splendid fountain, lots of trees and has a terrace bar great to be with friends. I strongly recommend this place to everyone, even at night to take a drink.The view over Lisbon is fantastic! Whether you can watch all the old part of Lisbon as the Castle of São Jorge and Restauradores, you can see as well more modern areas - Saldanha.
Wow!!!. Take the Gloria elevador (although too expensive...)!! Then take a coffee with a pasteis de nata on the terrace an just enjoy the view!
Beautiful day or night. A Lovely Viewing Point. It is Located at the top of Elevador da Gloria .This is a cobbled miradouro . It is nice and worth a visit.
One of the great views of Lisbon. Located near Bairro Alto and at the top of Gloria elevator

Stunning views of Baixa, Mouraria and Castelo. This is a cobbled miradouro (viewing point) located at the top of Elevador da Gloria and right next to Bairro Alto. The views are stunning, especially at night. Definitely worth a visit.And it's free!
